loans.name: Merly

texts.es: Merly de 43 años de edad es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 17 a 24 años. Ella vive en la ciudad de Cartagena donde tiene una panadería-repostería y vende panes, pudines y postres de  diversos colores, tamaños y formas; negocio para el que obtuvo su experiencia trabajando en panaderías del sector y que posteriormente se capacitó para desarrollar la tarea de una manera técnica y  desarrollar las buenas prácticas aprendidas en la academia. En la actualidad Merly provee de refrigerios, que incluyen sus productos, a 3 colegios en la comunidad donde habita y también tienen como clientes a hogares de bienestar cercanos, a quienes les vende los panes que dan a los niños cuidados por  madres sustitutas, en el programa de protección infantil del estado nacional. Las ventas las realiza diariamente mediante créditos que otorga entre 30 y 45 días;   esta forma de vender le genera uno  de sus mayores desafíos, que es el de tener efectivo disponible para provisionar los restaurantes escolares  y para invertir en sus enseres que están depreciados y generan incomodidades en sus procesos. En la actualidad Merly está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para apalancar los créditos que hace a sus clientes. Su inversión será exitosa porque cubrirá su demanda habitual y tendrá recursos para surtir su negocio y captar la atención de nuevos clientes, pues la demanda no la está satisfaciendo.

loans.use: comprará materias primas e insumos

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José, se decidido por un nuevo préstamo, debido a la necesidad de invertir en mariscos por la temporada y además se dispone a sembrar maíz, con este financiamiento comprara los insumos como el abono, herbicidas y una variedad de mariscos para ofrecer a la clientela.
La aspiración de José es que sus ventas mejores, manifiesta haber tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, ya que fue invertido en la compra de cerdos, por el momento está invirtiendo en algo nuevo.

loans.use: Compra de abono y herbicidas.

loans.name: Jeison

texts.es:
Jeison es un joven emprendedor que decidió montar su propio negocio con el ánimo de generar sus propios ingresos y contribuir económicamente en su hogar. Hace aproximadamente 5 meses montó su propio negocio el cual es una venta de prendas de vestir, las cuales ofrece principalmente a familiares, amigos y vecinos; de esta manera genera ingresos con los cuales contribuye económicamente en su hogar y se puede sostener sus propios gastos. Gracias a que ha tenido muy buenas ventas y su negocio fue montado con muy bajo capital, Jeison busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de prendas de vestir para aumentar su surtido y poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera sus ventas aumentarán considerablemente y podrá ofrecer en su hogar mayores ingresos para aumentar su calidad de vida. Además, así podrá seguirse costeando sus propios gastos, aliviando la carga económica de sus padres y progresando económicamente.

loans.use: Compra de prendas de vestir para aumentar su surtido y poder responder a todos los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Senderos De Paz Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Senderos de Paz está integrado por tres socias, las cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas en la Aldea de San Nicolás, Juticalpa, Olancho. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Marlen, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en los E.U.A. es una familia muy trabajadora y honrada. Marlen inició vendiendo unos cuantos productos de abarrotería y se dio cuenta de que las ganancias eran muy buenas así que decidió instalar una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación que atiende ella misma desde las 6:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. La ventaja es que tiene muy buenas ganancias en su negocio, y le da para sostener a su familia y educar a sus hijos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar unos balcones y pintar su casa. Con el apoyo del préstamo tendrá mayor seguridad en su hogar ya que pondrá los balcones. La señora Marlen actualmente no enfrenta ningún problema de salud pero en algunas temporadas las ventas bajan y sus ganancias también. Su meta es que las ventas en su negocio se mantengan estables para poder llevar el sustento a su familia. Ella tiene más de quince ciclos en FAMA y está muy agradecida con el apoyo que ha recibido.

loans.use: PARA MEJORAMIENTO DE VIVIENDA

loans.name: Rosa Imelda

texts.es:
Rosa, quiere mantener el negocio, por eso está solicitando un préstamo para mantener el nivel de inventario para su producción de platilos tipicos y comida rapida, esta compra será en maíz, leña, aceite, y otros condimentos que son necesarios para el negocio.
Con su préstamo anterior mejoro el negocio, comprando tambien materiales para mejorar las ganancias, la condición de ella y su familia ha mejorado.

loans.use: Compra de maíz, leña, aceite.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, siempre está dedicado a la agricultura, solicita otro préstamo para iniciar la siembra de maíz, pues comprara abono, semilla, alambre para cercar el terreno, donde cultivara.
El manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior aumento la productividad de maíz, manteniendo mejores ingresos de la cosecha, tambien la utilizo para la alimentación, considera estar mejor económicamente, con la esperanza que este nuevo préstamo le sirva de igual manera.

loans.use: Compra de abono, semilla y alambre.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ángela, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la granja, comprara 4 cerdos de engorde, para su granja, esto le ayudara para mantener suficiente cantidad y poder generar a futuro ganancias.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a la compra de insumos agricolas, ya que realizo la siembra de maiz, sus condiciones económicas ha sido más solventes, cancelo las cuotas de este préstamo, y espera seguir siendo buen cliente para la institución.

loans.use: Compra de cuatro cerdos.

loans.name: Alcides Antonio

texts.es: Alcides Antonio es un emprendedor que ha luchado de ser seguir su sueño de tener su propio negocio y sacar a su familia adelante, este emprendedor ya ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en crédito en el cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y muy trabajadora con el crédito anterior invirtió en el negocio en la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, jabón, detergentes, huevos, pan entre otros.

loans.use: comprar granos básicos, aceite, golosinas, jabón, detergentes, huevos, pan entre otros.

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, ella es socia de Finca Perú hace 11 años, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, ella aprendió en Finca Perú a ser buena negociante, como tratar al cliente y ser autosuficiente, también gracias a Finca Perú ella pudo construir su casa, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, leche, verduras y bebidas.

loans.use: Compra de arroz, azúcar,aceite,fideos,leche,verduras y bebidas

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina, dese invertir en el negocio de tortillas y venta de leña, para eso solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, por mayor cantidad, para mantener en el hogar y poder vender a los vecinos.
Ella considera que el préstamo anterior le dio la oportunidad de mejorar el negocio, manteniendo la clientela, esto le ha fortalecido, está motivada por continuar trabajando para superarse con su familia.

loans.use: Compra de maíz y leña.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d'un enfant, Prisca fait de bissap, des jus d'anana, de baobab et de crème. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de satisfaire sa diverse clientèle, et de maximiser son intérêt. Le revenu supplémentaire lui permettra d'assurer l'éducation et la bonne santé de son enfant.
texts.en: Prisca is married and has one child. She makes bissap, as well as pineapple, baobab, and cream[?] juice. She is well-versed with loans and has asked Finadev for a loan to satisfy her diverse clientele and maximize her interest. The extra revenue will allow her to assure the education and the health of her child.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of sugar, 10 flavorings, bissap (hibiscus) leaves, and one small refrigerator

loans.name: Ede Manuel

texts.es:
Ede Manuel tiene una fábrica de piezas dentales desde hace un largo tiempo, la cual inició su padre y trabajaba con el desde muy temprana edad. Cuando su padre murió, quedó a cargo de esta y ahora es su fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hija de 3 años de edad. En su fábrica, ha trabajado fuertemente con el ánimo de poderla sacar adelante y seguir teniéndola como su fuente de ingresos para ofrecer en su hogar una buena calidad de vida y una buena estabilidad económica. Gracias a que últimamente ha logrado tener muy buenas ventas, Ede Manuel busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de comprar la materia prima que requiere para la fabricación de sus piezas dentales y poder responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y podrá seguir teniendo unos ingresos estables para su familia. Ede Manuel sueña con que su negocio les permita progresar económicamente y poder comprar su casa propia.

loans.use: Comprar la materia prima que requiere para la fabricación de sus piezas dentales y poder responder a los grandes pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Jaime Wilbert

texts.es:
Jaime, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, él sigue siendo empleado de la Alcaldía, pero tiene la oportunidad de realizar la venta de repuestos usados, por esto está con la intensión de invertir un préstamo en la compra de repuestos, que le servirán para la venta y algunos para uso del vehículo propio.
Él considera que el préstamo anterior fue muy importante para salir con el gasto del vehículo, pero que ha logrado pagar el préstamo y ahora iniciar a comercializar repuestos.

loans.use: Compra de repuestos para vehiculos.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul es socio del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 29 años de edad, es socio de Finca Perú hace 2 años, es padre de 4 hijos, se dedica a la venta de papa por mayor, el aprendió a poder ahorrar, se da cuenta que esta progresando mucho y lo mejor es que aprende a ser buen padre y esposo, las capacitaciones que recibe en su Bancomunal le ayudan a tener los conocimientos de cómo hacer que su negocio crezca, ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de papa.

loans.use: Compra de papa

loans.name: Marly

texts.es: Marly llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde el año 2000, procedente de Sincelejo capital del departamento de Sucre, con muchos sueños e inició trabajando como operaria y contrajo matrimonio del cual nacieron 2 hijos, hoy en las edades de 6 y 9 años; este hecho le indicó que debía dedicarse mas tiempo a su hogar por eso dejó de ser empleada y empezó a realizar actividades que le permitieran generar ingresos simultáneos a la responsabilidad de su familia. Se inclinó por las artesanías armando piezas con herrajes, con los que fabricaba artesanalmente accesorios en plata, actividad que aprendió en un taller cercano a su vivienda, donde apoyaba a un vecino que trabajaba en platería. Por medios visuales de comunicación conoció de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se interesó en su programa de formación para emprendedores y posteriormente accedió a financiamientos con los que compró su laminador, con el cual fue gradualmente independizándose. Poco a poco pensando en diversificar su oferta, compró 4 vitrinas 1 motor toll, 1 perforadora, un equipo de soldar y agregó también mercancía variada convirtiendo su negocio en una miscelánea tal como hoy funciona;  en sus negocios es apoyada por su hermana, una amiga y su esposo, quienes comercializan las prendas que ella elabora. En su negocio vende a crédito y de contado, sus clientes se acercan a su negocio a comprar artículos de misceláneas, ya que cuenta con un espacio adecuado en la vivienda para la exhibición de sus prendas. En la actualidad Está aplicando a un credikiva, séptimo  financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de miscelánea como ropa, accesorios, útiles escolares, encajes  y mercancía que viene en oferta en su catalogo. Con sus anteriores créditos ha logrado su crecimiento empresarial y personal y ella lo considera así. Su sueño mas adelante es tener su propia casa, con instalaciones adecuadas para su negocio desde antes de ubicarlo y esto daría mayor confort a sus clientela, a si misma y a su familia, por lo cual se convierte en su principal desafío.

loans.use: comprará artículos de miscelánea como ropa, accesorios, útiles escolares, encajes  y mercancía que viene en oferta en su catalogo

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Arely, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, bebidas refrescantes, pues esto le ayuda a mantener lo necesario en el negocio para poder atender la demanda de los clientes, esperando que sea una buena experiencia este nuevo financiamiento.
Ella manifiesta haber tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, pues genero mayores ingresos para el sustento familiar, ha mejorado la situación económica de la familia.

loans.use: Compra de maíz, leña, bebidas refrescantes.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de ropa nueva y pollos de engorde, con esta inversión espera aumentar la mercadería de prendas de vestir como blusas, faldas, ropa interior, tambien iniciar con una  granja que aumentara con la nueva inclusión de pollos. 
Ella ha tenido un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, generándole el negocio más ganancias, esto la motiva a continuar trabajando para poder ir superándose con su familia.

loans.use: Compra de blusas, faldas, ropa interior y pollos de engorde.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana, quiere surtir el negocio de productos para la canasta básica, por eso está solicitando un préstamo que le ayude a invertir en gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, embutidos, huevos, condimentos, para estar preparada para atender la demanda, que espera que en la vacaciones aumente la afluencia de clientes.
Ella a través del préstamo anterior, logro mejorar el negocio, obteniendo más ingresos para mejorar su situación económica, cancelo la deuda y ha cubierto sus gastos familiares,  con el negocio se mantiene aportando para el bienestar de la familia y está satisfecha por lo que ha logrado.

loans.use: Compra de gaseosas, jugos, boquitas, embutidos, huevos, condimentos.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas por mayor, es socia de Finca Perú hace 16 años, ella ve todo lo que ha crecido y da gracias a Finca Perú por todo lo que le ayudo con los préstamos.Para ella los préstamos son muy buenos porque Finca Perú le da esa confianza que otras entidades no le dan, está muy agradecida porque gracias a ello  puede progresar junto a sus hijos y crecer como empresaria. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de papa.

loans.use: Compra de papa para su negocio

loans.name: Griselda De La Paz

texts.es:
Griselda, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para la compra de un pedido para la tienda, en el cual incluye: aceite, harina, pastas, azúcar, jabón, detergentes, pues son de consumo de primera necesidad, estos son demandados por sus clientes.
Ella dice que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener una mejor solvencia económica, atender la demanda, seguir en crecimiento con el negocio, para poderle ofrecer lo necesario a sus hijos.

loans.use: Compra de aceite, harina, pastas, azúcar, jabón, detergentes.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
Ivan trabaja en la actividad de la carpintería hace varios años gracias a que inicialmente trabajaba para una empresa de estas características y gracias a su experiencia adquirida decidió abrir su propio taller de carpintería, con el cual genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Ivan ha venido trabajando fuertemente para aumentar sus ventas, y ahora se ha visto reflejado en grandes pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes; es por esto que busca que un préstamo le permita comprar materias primas como madera y pegantes para fabricar los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

De esta manera podrá seguir trabajando en su propio taller y seguir generando un puesto de trabajo para una persona necesitada. Además, espera que su taller siga creciendo para que su familia tenga la oportunidad de acceder a mejores recursos económicos y poder superar las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida.

loans.use: Comprar materias primas como madera y pegantes para fabricar los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es: Celina es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 48 años de edad, es dueña de un restaurante, es madre de 2 hijos,gracias a las capacitaciones que recibió en su Bancomunal aprendió la responsabilidad, los valores y a no mentir, ella dice que la forma de trabajar de Finca Perú es muy buena porque le ayuda a estar bien preparada para cualquier dificultad, puede educar a sus hijos y eso le llena de mucha satisfacción. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una cocina y útiles de cocina.

loans.use: Compra de una cocina y útiles de cocina para su negocio

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 49 años de edad, es dueña de una panadería, ella misma prepara el pan, también vende comida y jugos, siempre se dedico a trabajar duro para poder progresar junto a sus 8 hijos. Es socia de Finca hace 4 años y pudo aprender muchas cosas que le ayudaron a valorarse y aprender a seguir progresando a pesar de las dificultades. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de harina y azúcar.

loans.use: Compra de harina y azúcar para su negocio

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es: Felicitas es socia del Bancomunal Suni, tiene 46 años de edad, no tiene hijos, vive con su mamá y su sobrina que se encuentra a su cargo, ella siempre trabajó para progresar junto a su mamá y su sobrina, ella se dedica  a la siembra y venta de vegetales, es dueña de una chacra, es socia de Finca Perú hace 7 años y está muy agradecida porque le ayudó a que su sobrina sea profesional, ella dice que cuando su papá tuvo Cáncer recibió mucha ayuda de Finca Perú y eso lo valora mucho, porque sabe que cuando más lo necesite la ayudarán. Ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de abono e insecticidas.

loans.use: Compra de abono e insecticidas para su chacra

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr Edgar tiene 30 años conviviente con su esposa más de 5 años, tienen 2 hijos dependientes que estudia en nivel primaria, con la actividad agrícola ,mantienen a su familia producen papa, haba, arveja, maíz en su terreno de 1.2 has que son herencia de sus padres, el sr. Eldgar y su familia viven en una comunidad rural de Iluri Grande a 42 km de distancia de la ciudad de Cochabamba, por lo tanto para ellos es muy difícil acudir a los Bancos para un préstamo de dinero y les piden muchos requisitos, se tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubre que el sr. Edgar  necesitaba dinero para la construcción de vivienda, porque el ahorro que tenía gasto en la compra de insumos agrícolas ( abono orgánico, semilla de papa) el sr. Edgar nos comenta que ahora construirá una vivienda para sus hijos para que vivan cómodamente.

loans.use: Construccion de vivienda

loans.name: Miriam Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Miriam de 50 años de edad, dedicada a la costura, con mas de catorce años dando sus servicios a sus clientes que gracias a la experiencia y al apoyo de su señor esposo quien es sastre  y que juntos han logrado la captacion de sus clientes. Lo que se propone con este nuevo financiamiento es invertirlo en la infraestructura de un cuarto entechado del mismo e instalacion de piso. Necesitando comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de zinc, piedrin, cemento, perlin, bloques, pegamento, soldadura, golosos , arena, ladrillos entre otros. Obteniendo con esta inversion que no se le pase el agua en su habitacion ahora que estamos a las puertas de los tiempos de lluvia en nuestro pais. Expresando que esta agradecida con kiva y la micro-finaciera por el apoyo al desarrallo de su negocio en financiamientos anteriores y en esta ocasión al mejoramiento de la infraestructura de su vivienda.

loans.use: Para la construccion de un cuarto

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 50 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, es socia de Finca Perú hace 2 años, es dueña de una tienda donde vende mochilas, ella pudo aprender acerca de cómo ahorrar, la solidaridad, gracias Finca Perú pudo comprar su casa y solventar los estudios profesionales de sus hijos,ahora el préstamo lo destinará para la compra de mochilas en variados diseños y colores para su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de mochilas en variados diseños y colores para vender

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es: Doña Petrona emprendedora, comerciante su negocio consiste en venta de articulos ferreteros, es atraves de sus ventas el medio de ganarse la vida y ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Con el prestamo anterior cambio el techo de su hogar, siendo de gran beneficio ya que para el tiempo de lluvia no se le pasa el agua. Sus planes es construir por completo su vivienda. Con este nuevo ciclo de credito comprara materiales para los conductos de aguas negras e instalacion de servicio higienico. Para cumplir este proyecto nuevo necesita la compra de los siguientes materiales: cemento, tuberías pvc, arena, hierro, golosa, laminas de zinc angulares, cajorold, codos, pegamentos,hinodro, puerta entre otros materiales. Con estas mejoras lograra alejar las enfermedades y obtener mejor higiene. Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por el continuo apoyo al mejoramiento de su vivienda.

loans.use: Instalacion de conductos de aguas negras e instalacion de servicio higienico

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia es socia del Bancomunal Nueva Vida, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos,es socia de Finca Perú hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de comida, con las capacitaciones de su Bancomunal ella aprendió a ser responsable, cómo ahorrar, cómo valorarse y ser autosuficiente. Gracias a Finca Perú ella pudo educar a sus hijos, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz por saco, aceite por mayor,fideos por mayor para su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de arroz por saco, aceite y fideos por mayor para su negocio

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es: Amparo, mujer luchadora, comerciante luego de dedicarse a la venta de tortillas y nacatamales actividad que le perjudico su salud manifiesta que decide cambiar de negocio por lo que hoy en dia su principal fuente de ingresos es la pulperia que tiene hace un año aproximado en su vivienda. Su esposo es contador en una cooperativa de buses y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa. Siendo su tercer credito sus poyectos con este es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, tambien generar mayores utilidades, cambiando su nivel de vida y opcionando a ofrecer a un mejor futuro a sus hijos por lo que comprara los siguientes materiales de construccion: cemento, arena, ladrillos, piedrin entre otros  y de esta manera llevar a cabo la instalacion de piso en cuartos y sala de su hogar. Agradece el apoyo a la oportunidad de optar a un credito para mejorar sus condiciones de la infraestructura de su vivienda. Su plan a futuro es construir toda su casa de concreto.

loans.use: Instalacion de piso en su vivienda

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es: La Sra. Lilian es de condicion humilde, tiene una hija a quien apoya moral y económicamente, actualmente es de Estado Civil separada, tuvo problemas con su esposo quien por ahora no le pasa Asistencia Familiar a su hija ya que tenia un vehiculo que compraron para que trabaje con Transporte Publico el cual ahora lo tiene la Sra. Lilian, pues su ex- esposo se le dio a ella para que pueda tener otro ingreso extra a parte del sueldo que percibe la cliente por concepto de Asistente Dental, motivo por el cual solicita un crédito para poder comprar una Linea de Taxi Truffis para que pueda afiliarse a ella y obtener mayores ingresos de esa manera poder apoyar aun mas a su hija quien estudia aun en la escuela y elevar su nivel de vida en el que se encuentra actualmente, se le fue dificil poder salir adelante pero con el apoyo de su familia logro salir y mejorar moralmente en la condicion que se encontraba, tiene muchas ganas de surgir y por ello se pido que se le otorgue el credito solicitado por la Sra. Lilian.

loans.use: Pago para Accion de linea de taxi Truffi

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria tiene ya más de dos años con su negocio, el cual es la venta de ropa usada, juguetes y zapatos. Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar ropa por mayoreo de temporada de verano y zapatos para toda la familia que le están ofreciendo a buen precio. Con esta inversión beneficiara mucho al negocio ya que tendrá mas variedad de mercancía y los clientes podrán tener más de donde escoger.
Doña Gregoria es originaria de Durango, pero ya tiene tiempo radicando en Nuevo Laredo, en el cual ha podido desempeñarse como comerciante y así poder sustentar a su familia ya que tiene dos hijos adolecentes que están estudiando.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía de ropa de temporada de verano

loans.name: Ma. Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe solicita un crédito, ya que se lastimo la pierna derecha y necesita de un tratamiento pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para pagar.
Doña Guadalupe trabaja para el municipio de Nuevo Laredo, en el departamento de parques y jardines. Con el sueldo que obtiene de su empleo para pagar el crédito, ya que su hijo que es una persona mayo le ayuda con los gastos de su casa. 
Desea mejorar su salud y con este tratamiento su perna esta mucho mejor y podrá trabajar sin problemas.

loans.use: Gastos médicos; pagar tratamiento

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria V. mujer trabajadora, honesta y humilde. Su esposo trabaja como albañil. Teniendo como  principal actividad la venta de pan y carne iniciando por cuenta propia. Aunque manifiesta la señora que por la situacion economica a veces sus ventas no son tan rentables es por ello que tambien lava y plancha ajeno. Una de sus metas es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda, es por ello que recurre al financiamiento ofrecido por afodenic, mismo que lo invertira en el entechado de su pequeña vivienda y en la terminacion de su cuarto para llevar a cabo este nuevo objetivo requerira comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera, reglas, clavos entre otros y asi comenzar la obra. Su plan a futuro es seguir mejorando su casita humilde que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado conseguir su terreno.

loans.use: Entechado de su casa y culminacion de cuarto

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.en:
Inspired by her mother and utilizing her 25 years of experience in the salon industry, Kimberly opened Teinte Hair Salon and Studio in early 2012.  Using mainly organic and non-carcinogenic products, Kimberly hopes to create a pleasant and non-intimidating space for her clients to receive quality hair care.  

Teinte, the French word for color, is Kimberly's salon specialty.  Using and selling organic, non-cancer causing chemicals, she provides her clients with quality and safe products both in the salon and at home.  A New Orleans area native, Kimberly is a practitioner of yoga, a triathelete and volunteers with the local chapter of an organization that works with abused and neglected children.  Her salon reflects her caring and nurturing nature and provides a peaceful space for her clients.  The salon also serves as a studio to display the work of local artists, like her daughter.  

After other options to fund her business fell through, Kimberly turned to Kiva to help her business.  With her Kiva loan, Kimberly will purchase retail products and cover operating capital.

loans.use: to purchase retail products and cover operating capital.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Marta Lorena continua con su negocio de ropa usada, mujer dedicada a la educacion de sus tres hijos, negocio mismo que le permite tener el mayor tiempo posible para atender a su familia, puesto que lo tiene ubicado en su propia casa de habitacion. En esta ocasión el uso que le dara a su credito es re-invertirlo en su negocio comprando una paca de faldas y una paca de ropa usada mixta, inversion que le ayudara a incrementar el inventario de su negocio y producto a esto que sus ganancias sean mejores. Agradece la confianza que Afodenic ha dado a su persona ya que por medio de financiamientos brindados por la misma micro-financiera ha venido aumentado su mercaderia y que su familia goce de mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Comprar dos paca de ropa usada para su negocio

loans.name: Wilson Israel

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre soltero de 25 años que vive en "Santo Domingo" que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Wilson trabaja como metalmecánico desde hace tres años, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y hoy en día trabaja junto a él. Está cursando sus estudios formales por lo cual necesita dinero para realizar su tesis y también si le sobra un poco de dinero piensa comprar materiales para su trabajo. Por esto ha solicitado a Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Wilson y KIVA un crédito, el cual le permita poder cumplir este objetivo personal. A pesar de ser su primer crédito, ha pasado la evaluación de su asesor como un cliente con bajo riesgo de incurrir en morosidad.

Trabaja seis horas al día, su oficio es considerado de riesgo ya que al soldar los objetos metálicos existen emanaciones de gases los cuales resultan altamente tóxicos, a pesar de ello piensa seguir con este oficio que hoy en día es su sustento.

Está muy optimista por estar más cerca de su título profesional; su sueño es tener su título profesional y luego, algún día construir su casa propia.

loans.use: para realizar su tesis de grado

loans.name: Orquidia Del Carmen

texts.es: Orquidia mujer esforzada y emprendedora, continua con su pulperia. Misma que ha sido el pilar para ella poder sacar adelante junto con su esposo a su familia. Manifiesta sentirse muy agradecida con la institucion por la oportunidad de pertencer a la familia de creditos. Siendo este su tercer ciclo de financiamiento lo que se propone con el es invertirlo en la infraestructura de su vivienda, construyendo divisiones internas a su hogar. Para llevar a cabo dicho proyecto requerira comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de plywood, laminas de zinc, cuartones de madera grande, clavos de zinc, clavos para madera, pintura de aceite, puerta  entre otros. Asegura el logro que tendra con estas mejoras y es que les ofrecera a su familia mayor privacidad y mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Para la construccion de divisiones internas en su hogar

loans.name: Salomon

texts.es: Don Salomon es un caballero luchador y esforzado. Hoy en dia continua laborando como guarda de seguridad trabajo de mucha entrega y dedicacion ya que mediante el mismo protege la vida de otros. Agradece a Dios primeramente y luego a Afodenic que ha sido el medio para el alcanzar muchas de sus metas. Con el prestamo anterior empezo a levantar de concreto estas dos habitaciones. Hoy en dia necesita el prestamo para comprar materiales de construccion como: doce laminas de zinc, dos puertas, tubos pvc, perlin, hinodoro entre otros y de esta manera llevar a cabo el plan el cual es la conclusion de de los dos cuartos mismos que por el alto costo de los materiales de construccion no los ha podido finalizar. Alcanzando por medio de este nuevo credito mejores condiciones de vida para su familia y para su persona un logro mas.

loans.use: Para finalizar la construccion de cuartos en su vivienda

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Aracely de 35 años de edad, comerciante que inicio hace varios años a trabajar para apoyar a su familia. Continua con su pulperia que ya desde hace once años aproximado es su principal sosten. Su esposo la apoya quien es vendedor de materiales de construccion en un camion. Juntos han logrado ir construyendo su vivienda de concreto. Para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda recurre al financiamiento. Hoy con este nuevo prestamo continuara la infraestructura de la parte frontal de su casa, es decir el porche de su hogar, por lo que necesitara comprar los siguientes materiales de construccion: laminas de zinc, perlines, porton de hierro, verjas de hierro entre otros y empezar asi la obra. Alcanzando con esto mayor seguridad para su vivienda y los suyos.

loans.use: Construccion de la parte frontal de su vivienda

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en: Phalla is 36 years old and leads a two-member loan group. She is married with one daughter and two sons. All of them are still in school. Phalla is a farmer for fifteen years now. This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested the loan to cultivate her rice farm and hopes that it will give good yield so that she can sell them in good price as such to increase her income. She wishes that she can set aside some saving to always keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To cultivate her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: Chhean, 57, is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved weaving Krama for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. One of her children is an electrician who earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her business, Chhean is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase threads and cloth for weaving more Krama to sell. By doing so, she would be able to produce more Krama and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a bathroom to provide hygiene living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase threads and cloth for weaving more Krama to sell

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan, 55, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice, mushroom and fattening up cattle for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 4 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Kan is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase materials for growing mushroom. This purchase would enable her to produce more mushroom to sell and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to the further profit to expand her business and build fence around the house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for growing mushroom

loans.name: Srim's Group

texts.en: Srim is a villager of Prey Chhor District and a leader of a group with two female members. She is 35 years old with two children who are still in school. She does rice farming and also raises pigs for additional income. She has been a farmer for almost 20 years. Srim received the first loan from VisionFund since 2011 and recently she requested for another loan to cultivate her rice field and also buy ladders for her house. With this loan, she hopes to increase her rice crops to earn sufficient income to support her family, send all her girls to school and also have a proper house.

loans.use: To prepare land and grow rice on it

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Oun, 52, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and dessert for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her daughter runs the beauty shop in the market and earns about USD 15 per day. And two other children are construction workers. Approximately, they earn USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Oun is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em would like to take a further loan to buy more products to sell from her stall. Em's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of goods to sell.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo, 40, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. All of her children are employed. They are fashion designer, garment worker and motor taxi driver. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Keo is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase one more motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her daughter and build a new house to provide comfortable living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase one more motorbike to commute

loans.name: Gansukh

texts.en: Mr. Gansukh, 46 has been working as a plumber privately since 1995. He has 3 sons and lives with his family in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a janitress in a state organization in many years. One of his son decided to run a taxi service beyond his classes. Actually he is a senior student in the college. His annual school fee is expensive to pay for his parent. Therefore he always wanted to assist his parent through the earning money by himself possible. At first he needs to buy a car for his first business. It will not be so expensive and it costs about of MNT 5,000,000 in the Mongolian auto markets. But he has a money lack of MNT 2,000,000 at the moment. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to cover the remaining cost of his purchasing car.

loans.use: To cover the remaining cost of his purchasing car.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Mr. Enkhjargal, 31 is a taxi driver and lives with his 2 children and his wife in the slum district of the Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business since 2008 and it is a main income source of this family now. Because his wife is unemployed and she responds her house works and cares her kids. Lately his car has been bad and damaged to some of its parts. It influences worst his business such as decreasing the earnings. So that he decided to repair and renovate his car. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the spare parts and make repair his car.

loans.use: To purchase the spare parts and make repair his car.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en: Sara, 31, is married, resides with her husband in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle for over four years. Additionally, she produce creel to sell to generate extra income to support the family. Approximately, she earns USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sara is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase farmland for growing more agricultural crops. This purchase would enable her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of buying creel from villagers to resale and rebuild her present house to make it comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing more agricultural crops

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr.Erdenetsogt, 47 is a photographer privately. He has been doing his business since last year. It is his very first business by himself. He lives with his mother and his brothers in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
In a day he has a lot of orders and jobs in last months. It shows his business will increase and expand in the further as he believes. Now he is planning to work with one of his friends jointly. So that he needs more photo camera and more equipment for their business. The he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the more work tools for his photography business.

loans.use: To purchase the more work tools for his photography business.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 47, is married, resides with her husband and nine children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sweet cake (A Kor cake) for over ten years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sarom is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store to sell the cake and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Minerba

texts.es: Minerva, tiene la edad  de  46 años, está casada,  vive con su hijo y el esposo actualmente. Ella  con el crédito pretende comprar  abarrotes como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, masa, aceite, sal, entre otras. Ella tiene pensado con este proyecto vender la mercancía a un precio mayor para así obtener ganancia y poder venderla a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad, así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: compra de abarrotes

loans.name: Yong

texts.en: Yong, 43, is married, resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 2 per day. Five of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 15 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Yong is requesting a loan of USD 600 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more groceries to sell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to purchase rice to store in the warehouse in order to resale when the price is higher. Moreover, she plans to build fence around her house and help her children get bachelor’s degree

loans.use: to raise capital in her business for purchasing more groceries to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de  22 años, está en unión libre,  vive con sus dos  hijos  y la  esposa actualmente. El  con el crédito pretende comprar café en almacigo para su posterior siembra en una pequeña propiedad. El tiene pensado con este proyecto en un futuro producir café para su posterior venta, así  obtener  ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: compra de almasigo

loans.name: Sey's Group

texts.en: Sey, a villager living in Thmor Kol district, is 55 years old and married with 9 children. Four of them are staying with the family and work as construction workers. Moreover, they do not have regular income. Sey borrowed the money from VisionFund for the first time. She now leads a group of three female members. She requested the loan to cultivate rice paddy during this hot season. With this loan, she hopes to make additional income on top of her children’s income. Netting off the daily expense in the family, she hopes to set aside some money for future needs such as spending on wedding ceremony for her four sons.

loans.use: To cultivate rice paddy during hot season

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Khon, 38, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has selling fruits for over seven years, earning approximately USD 9 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service (motor taxi). Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. Due to the present motorbike is too old; Khon is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one for her husband to run the service. This purchase would enable her husband to attract more customers and generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one for her husband to run the service

loans.name: Phina

texts.en: Phina, 33, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a chef. additionally, she sell groceries at home and earns about USD 3 per day. Her husband is an arc welder who earns approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Phina is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing agricultural crops

loans.name: Sok Ny

texts.en: Sok Ny, 37, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 4 per day. Three of her children are employed as garment workers and construction worker. Approximately, they earn USD 8 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sok Ny is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, tiene la edad  de  32 años, está casado,  vive con sus tres  hijos  y la  esposa actualmente. El  con el crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abono, agroquímicos, herbicida, foliares. El pretende tener el café en excelentes condiciones y con esta asistencia obtener el máximo de producciones del Café. El tiene pensado con este proyecto obtener  ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: compra de insumos

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mann is a mother of six children. Four of them are staying with the family and do rice farming. Mann and her family lives in wooden house in Thmor Koul district. As a farmer, she does not have sufficient income to support her family so she catches fish for reselling for additional income. This is the first loan Mann received from VisionFund. She requested the loan to cultivate rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes her rice crops grows in good quality and increase in quantity then sell it for a good price so that her family can have enough food and live in a better condition.

loans.use: To cultivate rice paddy

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, 34, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in rubber plantation for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Mao wants to run an additional business. Therefore, she is asking a loan of USD 1300 to pay for potato cultivation. This money will help her to acquire the security to start agricultural business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to pay for potato cultivation

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en: As a mother of two children, Neng earns a living by cultivating rice paddy and growing vegetables. She makes around three US dollars a day. After netting off expense, she could only save of around one US dollar. She used her saving to renovate house and expand her business. Neng has received the first loan from VisionFund in 2011. After completely repaid her debt, she requested another loan to prepare land for growing rice and vegetables. Now she leads a two-member loan group, all of whom are female. With the second loan, Neng hopes to save enough money to keep her boy and girl in school until finish highschool.

loans.use: To grow rice and vegetables

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Savon

texts.en: Savon, 39, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over two years, earning approximately USD 1000 3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the land in the village next to her house is cheap; Savon requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase the land in order to resale for a profitable price. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase the land in order to resale for a profitable price

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov is villager of Tbaung Khmum district. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still study. Pov supports the family by farming and spice planting. She can save around one US dollar a day after netting off the income and expense. This is her second loan with VisionFund. Pov is now a leader of a loan group with two female members. She requested the loan to cultivate rice field and do spice plantation with the left over money. Pov hopes the loan could help to increase her crops yield so as to increase income for her family so that she can renovate her house and keep all her children in school until finish highschool.

loans.use: To cultivate rice paddy and do spice plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Teng

texts.en: Teng, 45, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rubber for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 25 per day. In order to improve her business, Teng is requesting a loan of USD 625 to purchase more rubber plants to cultivate. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house next year.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber plants to cultivate

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas is a forty three year old married man with two children living in Kasese.His hardships are price fluctuation, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to educate children and his business goal is to expand business to new markets.Cleophas wants the money to buy sugar, rice and soap for sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and  soap for sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 49 years old widower with two children. He is a livestock farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan with kadet ltd .He was introduced t by a Kadet client. He will use the loan funds to build zero grazing unit on his farm.

His hopes and dreams are   to be a prominent farmer within his locality.

loans.use: Build a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en:
Subhi is photographed in his store for selling used home appliances.

Subhi is a 39 -year-old married man, he is a father with three sons and one daughter.
For the past three years, Subhi has been opening a store for selling used home appliances such as: used stoves, used washing machines and other used home appliances, which has been a profitable project,
but also not enough to cover all the costs.
Subhi is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing bulk of used home appliances for sale. In this way, Subhi will offer to his customers variety collection of used home appliances, this will lead to increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of used home appliances for sale.

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn, 34, is married, resides with his wife and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has been selling vegetables and fruits for over seven years earning approximately USD 6 per day. His wife runs a food store and earns about USD 5 per day. Due to the lack of fund, Voeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to raise capital in his business for purchasing more fruits to resale. By doing so, he would be able to earn more profit to support the family. In the future, he would like to use the further profit to expand his business and help his children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to raise capital in his business for purchasing more fruits to resale

loans.name: Chege

texts.en:
Chege is 52 years s old, married to Catherine and r they have four children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is his third loan with kadet ltd.He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He will use the loan funds to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor during planting.

He hopes to be a leading farmer in his area.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs i.e fertilizer

loans.name: Eum

texts.en: Eum, 64, is widowed and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker who receives support from the children. All of her children are employed. They are garment workers and waiters. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Eum is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase Tuk Tuk for her son to run the public transportation service. This purchase would enable her son to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk for her son to run the public transportation service

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 60 years single mother of five children. She is a poultry farmer and has been in  the business for the past two years.

This is her first loan with Kadet ltd .She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan to purchase more chicks and poultry feeds.

Her hopes and dreams to be a renowned farmer in her locality.

loans.use: Purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Sareith

texts.en: Sareith, 31, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in rubber plantation for over two years, earning approximately USD 11 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sareith is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to earn extra income to support the family. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living condition for the family and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Yonas

texts.en:
Yonas is a 24 year old single man who is living with his father, sisters and cousin. Yonas owns a paddy milling business. Prior to running the business Yonas used to work in a private company but he decided to resign from the job and initiated his own business. Yonas has been involved in the business for 7 months.

Paddy milling is a good business for him in generating money for his family. To offer the service, Yonas usually operates the business from one village to another. 

Yonas is seeking a loan for the business improvement. He wants to buy a new paddy milling machine as the old one often cannot work properly. This situation led Yonas to request loan from TLM amounting to IDR, 10,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase a new paddy milling machine

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 year old, married to Ann and they have two children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan with kadet ltd of kes 50,000.He was introduced by a Kadet client. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and potato seedlings for planting.

His hopes and dreams are to be a leading mixed farmer in his area.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: No

texts.en: No, 33, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been running the business of purchasing poultry to resale for over two years, earning approximately USD 20 per day. Her husband runs public transportation service (motor taxi). Additionally, he is involved in breeding pigs at home to generate extra income to financially support the family. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. No wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, No is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This loan would enable her provide comfortable living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 39 year-old mother of five children, all of whom are working as construction workers in Thailand. To support the family, she has been farming, grow vegetables and work as a construction worker to make additional income. She earns around three US dollar per day. Mom is a new client to VisionFund. She requested the loan to buy water pump. The water pump will help her by not carrying water from the river to water her crops and farm. She hopes to grow her rice and vegetables in good quality and sell in good price so that she can have more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase water pump

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 65 years old widow. She has been selling clothes for the last 10 years. 


This is her first loan with kadet ltd, she was introduced to KADET by one of the existing clients. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes for sale.

In the future, Edith hopes to invest more in her business and use the proceeds for poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Izzeddeen

texts.en:
Izzeddeen is photographed inside his barber shop.

Izzeddeen is a 26-year-old young single man, for the past two years, Izzeddeen has been opening Barber shop, which has been a profitable project, but also not much enough to cover all the costs.

Izzeddeen is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new Barber kit and improving the shop's condition such as: installing new shelves and mirrors, painting. Taking this loan will create new image to the Barber shop that will attract recent customers and new customers, and the new kit will provide added value and high quality to his work, that will lead to increase Izzeddeen's income.

loans.use: To improve the shop's condition and purchase new barber kit

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay, 57, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and vegetables to sell. Approximately, she earns USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They are garment worker and construction worker. They earn about USD 8 per day. Lay wants to rebuild her present house. With this goal in mind, Lay requests a loan of USD 700 to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house. This loan would enable her to provide convenient living condition for her family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business which is involved animals husbandry to generate more income to stabilize the family’s living condition.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to rebuild her house

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 61 years old married to Anna and they have six children. He is a scrap metal dealer and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is his first loan with kadet ltd,he was introduced by a Kadet client. He will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of scrap metal for resale.

His hopes are to expand his business and employ more employees.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen, 63, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years and are successful in their career. Additionally, her husband runs the business of purchasing cattle to resale to generate more income to support the family. Approximately, they earn USD 8 per day. Her two children are employed in garment factory. They earn about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s economy, Sen is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital in her husband’s business to purchase cattle to resale. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to raise capital in her husband's business to purchase cattle to resale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 44 year old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school. 

Asha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is photographed in the herd next to the sheep he is raising.

Sabri is a 52 -year-old married man, he is a father of seven sons and two daughters, all of them are above 18 years old.

For the past 15 years, Sabri has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project, but also not enough to cover all the costs.

Sabri is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more sheep and bulk of fodder to feed the sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fodder and more sheep.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Meas, a resident who has been residing in Kompong Cham province. She is 49 years old and a widowed mother of 2 single children working as servants in Phnom Penh city. As they’re working, they can help their mum earn income and better the living condition. Both of them got low-education due to the family experienced financial need and quit studying at primary school level. Meas is in the business of cultivating rice and vegetables. She selects crops to grow based on the season. And she has been in this business for more than 21 years. There are many works to do at the field. However, she tries to work hard.

This is her sixth loan from HKL, she has already paid back her previous loans as scheduled successfully. And now, she would like to acquire this loan to purchase an additional plot of farmland to improve her business. This will enable Meas to increase her household income.

loans.use: to purchase an additional plot of farmland to improve her business.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 39 year old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Anna heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rom

texts.en: Rom, 33, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been working in the factory for over a year, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband produces palm sugar to sell and earns about USD 4 per day. Due to a plot land in the village next to her house is cheap; Rom is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase the land to construct a house for her children. In the future, she would like to run an additional business which is involved in animal husbandry to generate extra income to support the family, and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase the land to construct a house for her children

loans.name: Wanyona

texts.en:
Wanyona is 52 years old married to Mary and they have 4 children. He sells watermelons for the last 7 years.

He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his 1st loan with Kadet ltd. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of watermelons to meet increased high demand

His hopes are to become a watermelon farmer and the leading watermelons supplier and retailer.

loans.use: Tpo buy more stock

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 39 year old, married, and has five children; all of them are still in school. 

Rina heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 29-year-old young married man, he is a father of one daughter, his wife is employed in a local institution and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

Nidal is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of completing finishing the house such as: installing tiles, painting, installing windows and doors. This will improve the house's condition and enable Nidal and his family to live in the house soon and enjoying suitable living conditions.
Nidal is photographed the picture.

loans.use: To complete finishing the house.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three month. She is 31 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Flora heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Ton, 61, is married, resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, her husband is a construction foreman. Approximately, they earn USD 8 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Ton is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase construction equipments for her husband to use in his work. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business to able to get larger construction projet.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipments for her husband to use in his work

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 57 years old and a single mother of five children. She sells green peas and potatoes for the past two years.

This is her first loan with Kadet ltd She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan funds to purchase stock of peas for resale.

Her hopes are to purchase a stall in the market to do her business.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Batjargal is a-37-year-old married lady who lives with her family in a ger, traditional Mongolian felt tent, in outer ger district lacks basin infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

She supports her family by operating retail business at local indoor market since June 2011. She has about 2.4 million Mongolian Tugriks(MNT) in working capital. She usually sells women bags and hand bags which from Beijing, China. 

Depending the beginning of spring season, she needs a variety of bags to sell, so Batjargal is requesting a 1.800.000 MNT loan to purchase bags to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan lives in Buluk. She sells tea, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Hanan heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, tea leaves. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin owns a small store selling snacks, groceries and beverages from her own house, located in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is 42 years and married with 3 school-age children. They totally depend on her income. Sin also works as a local farmer. Crops husbandry is the main business for the whole family. She grows rice, potatoes and vegetables based on the season and the market demand.

Sin has applied for a loan from Kiva, through HKL to rent a medium-sized plantation from other villagers to grow potatoes. This loan will enable the improvement of her business. She hopes that she is able to have a good harvest in the following months.

loans.use: to rent a medium-sized plantation from other villagers to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Pictured above is Mustapha, a businessman in Kabala town. A native of Mongo village, the forty year old is married to a businesswoman and the couple has one child together. Their child is attending primary school. Mustapha has been a businessman for five years now. Mustapha produces and sells balusters. He has requested for a loan of 2,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to make more balusters for sale.

loans.use: to make more balusters for sale

loans.name: Ju;ius

texts.en:
Julius is 37 year s old married to Sarah and they have three children. He is a banana trader and has been in the business for the past four year.

This is his first loan with kadet ltd he was introduced by a Kadet client. He will use the loan amount to purchase bananas in whole sale for resale.

His hopes are to purchase a truck to help in transport of stocks to premises and distribution of bananas.

loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org is very pleased to present to you Isatu, a businesswoman from the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Isatu is a native of Sinkunia, she is thirty-eight years old. She is married to a businessman and has three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Isatu sells onions, flour, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), sugar, salt, bowls, dishes, etc. She has requested a loan of 5,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, flour, margi, sugar, salt, bowls, dishes, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Houn, age 34, lives with her husband and five single children in Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She works in the same types of business as her husband. Rice is the sole of the family’s main income. Houn is diligent in her work and tries hard to provide her children a further education, so they might have good jobs in the future and avoid working physically. 

In order to improve her business, Houn would like to borrow a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a threshing machine for using in the business. Also, she can use it to provide threshing service to local farmers in exchange for money or rice. She hopes to earn a better living from this investment.

loans.use: to borrow a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a threshing machine for using in the business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Salone Microfinace Trust is very pleased to present to you Sarah who is a businesswoman in Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. The thirty-nine years old Sarah is married to a farmer and the couple has three children – one is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school. Sarah, a native of Kabala town, she sells rice, palm-oil, etc. Sarah has been doing business for eleven years now. She has asked for this loan in order to buy more rice and palm-oil to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice and palm-oil to add to her business

loans.name: Thunny

texts.en:
Thunny is aged 52, married and lives with her husband and her kid in a village of the Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She earns a living through selling vegetables in the local market to support the family while her husband, 52, does some plantation in the village. Having been in this business for almost 35 years, she in average can earn up to US$15 per day from her current business and she can afford to set aside some money of nearly US$4 per day. 

This is the third loan for Thunny with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. Since with VisionFund for two cycles, the loans have helped her expand her business and enabled her to support her family quite better. With good business, she is applying for another loan of US$1,500 to buy more vegetables for resale and use a portion to buy vegetables store in the market to sell vegetables. She hopes that this loan will enable her to own a vegetables store so as to increase her vegetables business and make her family better.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale and vegetables store

loans.name: Korkrie Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Korkrie” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mohamed is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a trader and they have three school going children. Mohamed has been a businessman for seven years now; he is currently selling clothes for both men and women.  With  this loan, Mohamed is going to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to his current stock

loans.name: Takili Finoh Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Takili Finoh” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Fatmata is the leader of this group. The forty-year-old is married to a trader and the couple has three children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for eight years now, she sells market-food – pepper, onions, salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy pepper, onions, salt, margi, etc. at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresiah is 40 years old and married to Daniel and they have two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her first loan with Kadet ltd .She was introduced by a Kadet client. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

Her hopes are to purchase another plot of land to expand her farming output.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Ta Marr Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Ta Marr” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Kumba is the leader of this group. Kumba is forty-year-old, she is married to a trader and the couple has four children – one in primary school, two in secondary school and one not of school going age. Kumba sells salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, fish, etc. She has been a businesswoman for eleven years now. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, onions, fish, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Tawopsu Group

texts.en:
