Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tawopsu” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Mariatu is the leader of this group. She is forty-two-year-old, married with three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mariatu sells cooking oil, salt, pepper, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, garden-eggs, etc. With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying a larger quantity of cooking oil, salt, pepper, margi, onions, garden-eggs, etc. to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of cooking oil, salt, pepper, margi, onions, garden eggs, etc to add to her business

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
A villager in the village located in an area of the Sa Ang district, Khorn is aged 52 and married. He has four children but only two of them (one daughter and one son) are still dependent on him. His son is still in school while her daughter is at home helping family's housework and business. Khorn and his wife earn a living through planting cabbage and pepper. He has been in this business for 30 years. 

Khorn has been with VisionFund for one year. The loan has helped him to send his son to school and support his family better. Now he is requesting another loan with VisionFund of US$1,000. He is going to use this loan to buy cabbage seeds and gasoline to carry water for his vegetables plantation. This loan will enable him to grow more cabbage healthily and big. He hopes to earn more income and keep his son in school.

loans.use: To buy cabbage seeds and gasoline for his vegetables plantation

loans.name: Kimemia

texts.en:
Kimemia is 62 years old married to Naomi and they have three children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his second loan with kadet ltd. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

His hopes are to improve his farming output by  adding another piece of land.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Agnes heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be determined and ambitious. He operates a retail stall where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a very busy market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of shoes. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes for selling. His business goal is to run two more retail stall selling shoes within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for selling.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is aged 41, married. She lives with her husband and two dependent children in a village of the Sa Ang district. Her children are working at family's business. To support the family, she and her husband have been buying and selling stove for almost 20 years. 

Pha has been with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. The loans have been her significantly improve her living condition. Currently, she is able to earn up to US$15 per day and saves nearly almost US$10 each day. Now requesting another loan of US$800, she is going to use the entire loan to buy more stoves for sale. She hopes to increase her business and earn larger income to improve lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more stoves for sale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in Buluk. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 38 year old, married, and has two children; all of them are still in school. 

Jackline heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Wejdan

texts.en:
Wejdan is a 35 years old single lady from Baqa'a, Jordan.
Wejdan has  abeauty salon and she is looking expand her business thus she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to to purchase accessories and cosmotics products for trading purposes.
Wejdan started her business years ago through selling accessories and cosmotics from her house then she opened a beauty salon with her sister.
Wejdan is looking to improve her family life conditions and increase their livivng standards.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and cosmotics products for trading purposes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Buluk. She sells food stall, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase beans, tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26 years old single man from al russeifeh, Jordan.
Ahmad started his business three years ago, he was distributing mobile phones accessories to shops using his bus then with his hardwork he could establish a shop for his business.
Now, Ahmad is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to to purchase new goods for his shopand renew decorations.
Ahmad is looking to increase his income and his family livivng standards as weell.
because ahmad is under 30 years old, his oan consideredas a ayouth loan.

loans.use: to purchase new goods for his store and renew decorations

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  is a 45 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be faithful and determined. She operates a grocery stall where she sells onions. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a very busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity in the area of operation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more onions for selling. Her business goal is to venture into new business of rental houses services within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more onions for selling.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 year old, married, and has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Margret heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Zain

texts.en:
Zain is a a44 years old married woman from Baqa'a, Jordan and a mother of 3 children.
Zain has an exeptional talent in decorating flowers she learned that from her neighbor then she could make her own business that insures her a modest income.
Zain is looking to expand her business, thus she is requesting a loan of 1100 JD to to purchase eqipments needed for decorating flowers.
an aspiration of Zain is to educate her children and provide them with a better life.

loans.use: to purchase eqipments needed for decorating flowers

loans.name: Ayed

texts.en:
Ayed is a 24 -year-old young single man, he is a factory employee with a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his costs and needs.
Ayed is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of improving the house's condition such as: painting and installing new doors instead of the old one. This will improve Ayed's home living condition.
Ayed is photographed inside his house.

loans.use: To improve the house's condition

loans.name: Development Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Development” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking for a loan of 2,600,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to develop their respective businesses.

The leader of this group is Adama. Adama is age thirty-seven; she was born in Bumbuna village but she is currently residing in Magburaka, together with her husband and eight children. Her husband is a security guard and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Adama has been a businesswoman for eight years now. She sells margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, tomatoes, pepper, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy margi, salt, tomatoes, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, tomatoes, pepper, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Salha

texts.en:
salha is a conservative person she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her husband, Ayoub.
Salha is a 37 years old married woman from al russeifeh, Jordan and a mother of 6 children.
Salha is looking to improve her family life conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance for her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmed has been farming a plot of land in Gaza since 2008. It is in an area well known for its fertile soils. Ahmed’s loan will allow him to purchase a new irrigation system. This will help protect his peas from drought, increase the output of his farm, and increase his income. Ahmed is 25 years old and unmarried. His goals for the future are to start a family and provide well for it.

loans.use: to purchase a new irrigation system

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old married to Marry and blessed with two children. He owns a music stall/shop and sells music discs and movies for the last 5 years. 

 He was introduced to KADET by one of the field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy a music player and television.  

His hopes are to expand his business to operate as a registered company and start a music production studio.

loans.use: To buy music player

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en: Japheth is a single man. He describes himself to be courageous and open minded man. He operates a bicycle and retail store such as sugar, salt, flour, sodas etc where he provides motorcycle transportation. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located within a busy and conducive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of fuel. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy home products for selling. His business goal is to own a cab to increase the mode of transportation within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy home products for selling.

loans.name: Siek

texts.en:
Siek is now 25 years old, married and has two children. She and her husband are rice farmers who have been cultivating their own one hectare of rice paddy for seven years to make a living. This is only primary source of income for her family. Living in the area of the Prey Chhor district, Siek has been challenging low crop yield from rice farming and lack of capital to support her primary business. With her current business, she can earn about US$7 per day to feed her family. 

This is the first loan for Siek with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund. To overcome the challenge she's faced several years, she is now applying for a loan of 4,000,000 Khmer riels to buy another plot of farmland to increase her rice farming production. This loan will enable her to increase farming capacity so as to make more rice to make her living better.

loans.use: To buy another plot of farmland to increase her rice farming production

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ferdinan

texts.en:
Ferdinand is a 32-year-old man and is married to Dor, a 32-year-old lady. At the moment they haven’t had any children yet. Ferdinand and Dor are still living with Ferdinand’s parents. To cover their daily needs Ferdinand runs a Kiosk business. 
Ferdinand provides daily needs such as biscuits, detergent, bath soap, cigarettes, candies and snacks. Ferdinand was thinking to improve his business by providing more stocks such as rice, sugar, coffee, cigarettes, instant noodle, etc.  To make it happen he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as rice, sugar, coffee, cigarettes, instant noodle, etc.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir owns a metal workshop in Gaza. He is taking out a loan to buy a welding machine for his workshop. The new machine will increase his production capacity and, therefore, his income.

This loan is enabling Bashir to increase his income, which he is saving for marriage and starting a family. He is 21 years old and a secondary school graduate.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for his workshop

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 50 years old. He lives in a small village of Samtredia District with his family: wife – Marina and 21 years old daughter; she is a student. Marina works as a saleslady on local store. She gets monthly salary in the amount of 200 Laris per month. Along with the above mentioned the family sells small harvest of nuts, they receive per year. Total average monthly income of the family is 250 Laris. According to Credo estimations they belong to subsistence poor category. 

With the requested credit Avtandil will re-start functioning of a family owned bread bakery. A year ago Avtandil stopped the business, because he didn’t have any funds for financing bakery’s ongoing costs. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Avtandil will purchase flour and wood. He will produce traditional Georgian bread and sell it in the village. The income of the family will increase by 300 – 400 Laris, which will mean 120 – 160% increase. The living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase flour for re-starting the bakery

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly lives in Buluk. She sells clothes, and has been in business for three years. She is 43 year old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school. 

Lilly heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 32 year old single woman. She has a son who is 12 years old. She describes herself to be humble, social and principled . She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes for selling. Lucy dream and  business goal is to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 30 years old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of 2 children.
Abeer is looking to improve her family life conditions and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to do maintenance for her house.

loans.use: to do hiuse maintenance

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives in Buluk She sells charcoal, and has been in business for five years. She is 44 year old, married, and has six children; all of them are still in school 

Laura heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in future

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Obet

texts.en:
Obet is a 35 year old man. He is married to Aksa, a 33 year old lady. They have 3 children namely: Ofni, 10, is attending the 4th grade of Elementary School; Barto, 7, is attending the 1st grade of Elementary School; and Alfiano, 2 years old. 

To cover his family needs, Obet initiated a poultry business 3 years ago. He built a stall with capacity to hold 600 chicks. Obet needs 3 up to 4 weeks to raise the chick before sell them. 
Obet intends to purchase 6 boxes of chicks and to enlarge the cage, but he does have money to do so. He heard that TLM provided a loan for the small entrepreneur like him. Obet then applied for a loan of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM for his business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase 6 boxes of chicks and to enlarge the cage,

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is an entrepreneur who despite his young age already owns his business and has formed a family that’s always by his side. He is 27years old, married and has a two year children who has always been his motivation to work hard in his business. he started working in grocery stores because his family has had that type of business and he acquired experience there. 

One day he decided to open his own grocery store where he sells basic staple items and thanks to this he contributes economically to his home’s income. Because he set up the store with very little capital, Ibrahim does not have sufficient money so he can’t offer his customers more products that need to be kept. Because of this, he is requested a youth loan of 250000 YER from AMB to be able to buy soft drinks, canned foods  to increase the variety of items he offers for his customers.

Ibrahim hopes that in this way his customers will find his store still more attractive thus increasing his sales considerably. Also, he hopes that with higher income his family will be able to enjoy a better quality of life. He dreams with having a large grocery distributorship where he can generate employment for people most in need.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned foods  to increase the variety of items he offers for his customers.

loans.name: Yaqoub

texts.en:
Yaqoub is photographed next to the old kit he is using to install Air Conditions.

Yaqoub is a Palestinian married man, he is a father of two sons and four daughters.

For the past seven years, Yaqoub has been installing Air Conditioning to customers, which has been a profitable project, but also not that much enough to cover all the costs.

Yaqoub is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new kit for installing Air Conditioning such as: different types of drills and screws, Filters and special materials to clean Air Conditions. This will increase the quality of Yaqoub's work and improve the family's income to better.

loans.use: To purchase new kit for installing Air Conditioning

loans.name: Kasor

texts.en:
Aged 30, Kasor is the mother of two dependent children who are too young to go to school. She lives with her husband and two children in a village located in the Sa Ang district. She sells food in the village while her husband is construction builder. She has been in this business for almost 30 years to support her family. Sometimes, they work for others to gain additional income.

Kasor has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely repaid the loans with VisionFund. The loans have enabled her to increase family's income and afford sufficient food to eat. She now can earn up to US$18 from her current business and is able to save around US$6 each day. Now requesting another loan of US$700 with VisionFund, she plans to use the loan to buy more construction materials such as sand, metal, cement etc. and use a portion to increase food business. She hopes to increase her business to earn more income and send her two children to school when they are at school age.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials and increase food business

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem lives in Gaza and has managed a grocery store since 2008. His store is well-located as it is next to a major souk (market). He is taking out a loan from Ryada to purchase a greater variety of goods for his store to resell to his customers.

Waseem is 29 years old and has a fiancé. He hopes to have a wedding and start a family soon. This loan will allow him to increase his business activity and income, which he will use towards realizing his goal.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of goods for his store

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a 27-year-old married man. He has a child. He operates a grocery business and sells his goods in a shop. He's worked in this business for few years. His primary customers are neighbors. He describes his greatest business challenge to be fluctuations of market prices. 

Sultan asked for a youth 100000 YER from AMB to purchase bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour. He aspires to open a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar, rice, cooking oil and flour for his business.

loans.name: Valeri

texts.en:
Valeri is 56 years old. He lives in Khoni district with his 14 years old daughter Khatia. She goes to school. Valeri’s wife is out of the country. She works abroad and helps her family financially. Valeri grows maize on family owned plot of the land. He sells harvested maize in the village. Total average monthly income of the family equals to 200 Laris. The family lives in poverty.  Valeri requested credit for start-up of a grocery store. He has constructed small building for store. It is located nearby his house. With the requested credit Valeri will purchase refrigerators for the store as well as some grocery products for resale. According to Valeri’s estimations his store will work well, as there are no more similar stores, also he will attract clients with quality service and wide assortment of products. 

Valeri’s loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. After the start-up of the business, the living conditions of the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators for start-up of a grocery store

loans.name: Juah

texts.en: Juah live in Compound#3,she is 50 years old , and did not go to school,married with four children between the ages of 23 and 34,they  are  living on their own,working and attending school,she has been selling dried and fresh fish when she was at the ages 9,she is requesting a loan to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business,she faced  problem during  the rainy season,she  enjoy her bu

loans.use: to buy more dried and fresh fish for her business

loans.name: Naing's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Tbaungh Khmum district, Naing is a 37-year-old mother of two daughters and now they are still in school. Rice farming is the primary source of income for her family to support the living. To earn more income, she plants some cassava on her 0.5 hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for 12 years. Currently, she can earn about US$3 per day from her business. 

This is her second loan with Kiva's field partner, VisionFund, for her group of two female members. After successfully paying back the first loan, she could afford to buy a small plot of farmland for plantation. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She is requesting 1,000,000 Khmer riels while her group member Ream is requesting 1,200,000 Khmer riels. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and keep her daughters in school until finish.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Mun is 42 years old, married and has three children (one daughter and two sons). They all are still dependent on her and still in school. She lives in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district farming rice as primary source of income to support her family. She has been farming one-hectare farmland for 12 years. With her current business, she can earn about US$3.5 per day and manages to save about US$1 each day for the future. 

Mun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and successfully repaid the loan with VisionFund. The previous loan has enabled her to afford to buy a small plot of farmland. She and her group member who is just with VisionFund this loan cycle are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Khmer riels and 500,000 Khmer riels respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yields and earn more income to keep her children in school until finish.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Progress-Iii Group

texts.en:
Yarie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yarie was born in northern Sierra Leone thirty-eight years ago. She is married and has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. For ten years now, Yarie has been selling palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and gari (food made out of cassava roots). 

This is the first loan that Yarie and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Yarie will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones) to expand her business, she will buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil and gari in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Yankafisa Group

texts.en: Farah is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Farah was born in northern Sierra Leone thirty-three years ago. She is married to a housewife with no children. Farah is a carpenter and has been in this profession for twelve years now. With the help of this loan, Farah is going to buy working materials like board in order to make a lot of furniture for sale.

loans.use: to buy working materials like board in order to make a lot of furniture for sale

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is photographed ( the right side) with her daughter.

Haneen is a Palestinian married woman, her husband is employed and gets a salary, but not much enough to cover all the costs.

For the past two years, Haneen has been making and selling to customers hand made food ( Palestinian traditional food)such as: different types of salads like Tabboleh, different types of cooked food like Mansaf, also she is buying olive oil and resell to customers upon their requests, which all of these have been a profitable projects.

Haneen is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing bulk of vegetables, dairy products, olive oil. Taking this loan will offer to Haneen the necessary raw materials to continue in her project and offer the requested amounts to customers, this will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of vegetables, dairy products, olive oil

loans.name: Sabumorgie Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Sabumorgie” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Tenneh is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a businessman and they have six children. Tenneh has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells planks. With her share of this loan, she will buy planks in large quantity to sell in the capital city Freetown.

loans.use: to buy planks in large quantity to sell in the capital city Freetown

loans.name: Best Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Best” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businessmen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva in order to seek a loan of 2,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for the entire group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Sulaiman. Sulaiman was born in Kabala town about fifty-four years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children, three of whom are attending primary schools. Sulaiman sells roast meat. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy more meat to roast for sale.

loans.use: to buy more meat to roast for sale.

loans.name: Shaher

texts.en:
Shaher is a 45 -year-old married man, for the past two years, Shaher has been opening a grocery store, which has been a profitable project, but also not much enough to cover all the costs.

Shaher is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing variety of goods and groceries that are often requested by customers such as: rice, milk, sugar, cook oil.
This will increase sales and improve the family's income.
Shaher is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: Increasing the variety of goods sold in the store

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan is a 42 -yaer-old married woman, she is a mother of three sons and three daughters, her husband is a worker who earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs and costs.

For the past seven years, Asmahan has been opening a grocery store, which has been a profitable project to the family.

Asmahan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing collection of missing necessary groceries that customers usually request such as: flour, milk, rice,..etc. 
This will increase sales and improve the family's income.
Asmahan and her husband are appear in the picture, photographed in the grocery store she has.

loans.use: To purchase necessary groceries for sale

loans.name: Allah Thantho Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Allah Thantho” group from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)  for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Marie is the leader of this group. The thirty-two-year-old is married to a retired worker and they have three children. Marie has been a businesswoman for six years now, she sells plastic bowls, plates, buckets, spoons, and ready-to-wear-clothes.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, plates, buckets, spoons, and ready-to-wear-clothes at wholesale to add to her current ones

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 42 year old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be honest and hardworking. She operates a food stall where she sells food such as chips, doughnuts etc. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located near a school and her primary customers are students and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients . Her business goal is to venture into a business of potato retail business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Buluk. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for two years. She is 45 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Mary heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Buluk. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bean, sugar for sale.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is 22 years old. She lives in Pshatavan village with her family: husband, two children and parents-in-law. The family's man income comes from farming. They have founded a grape orchard. In order to develop agriculture and make it more profitable, Ani has decided to start breeding cattle, too. She has applied for this loan to purchase 3 cows and implement this goal. 
Ani expects increase of income, which she plans to invest in development of farming. In particular, she wants to purchase stakes for the grape orchard.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 35 years old married to Rachael and they have four children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past two years.

This is his first loan with kadet ltd .He was introduced by a Kadet client. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and potato seeds for planting.

His hopes are to increase his farming land in the near future.

loans.use: Purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Nurah

texts.en:
Nurah lives in kator. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Nurah heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase onions, tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be focused, customer friendly and independent. She operates a retail store where she sells handbags. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be sometimes customers delay payment. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy bags . Mwanaidi's dream and  business goal is to run a boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy bags for selling.

loans.name: Rula

texts.en:
Rula is a conservative person she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet thus the man in the photo is her husband.
Rula is a 30 years old married womanf rom al salt, al balqa' Jordan and a mother of 1 child.
Rula is looking to improve her familty life conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 700 JD to do maintebnance for her house.

loans.use: to do miantenance for her house

loans.name: Affa

texts.en:
Affa lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 35 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Affa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 26 years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia with his family: wife – Tamar, two sons (3 and 2 years old), father and grandmother. Zurab is the only income provider in the family. He trades on local open market, he sells nuts and maize. The family lives bellow the poverty line and they receive social assistance from local government. Total average monthly income of the family is 270 Laris, including social assistance. Zurab requested credit for start-up of a trade business. 

His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Zurab will purchase a mini-bus. He will use it for trade with Fruits and Vegetables. Zurab will purchase fruits and vegetables from local farmers in wholesale prices and take them to nearby towns by the mini-bus for resale. According to Zurab’s estimations the monthly income of the family will increase approximately by 300 Laris, which means 110% increase. Zurab will be able to create better living conditions for his children, as well as other family members; along with the abovementioned the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on country’s capital market in the future, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for trade with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Narjes

texts.en:
Narjes is a 30 years old married woman from al zarqa, and a mother of two child.
Narjes is selling clothes and blanktes, she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new quantities of clothes and blankets for trading purposes.
Narjes is looking to establish a store for her business and insure her children education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and blankets for trading purposes

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 years old and single mother of five children.  She owns a food kiosk and has been in operation for 20 years earning a monthly income of kes 9,500. 

This her first loan with kadet of kes 30,000 ,she plans to  use the amount to purchase cooking fat, wheat flour, maize flour, maize and beans rice,tea leaves. With the anticipated profits she will plough back into the business and educate her child.

Her dream is to grow her business and expand to other areas.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her business

loans.name: Fakher Eddine

texts.en:
Fakher Eddine is 42-year-old married man, father of three children, who opened 8 years ago his own grocery store. Fakher Eddine works also in transportation, thought of starting a new stable business to improve his family's living, and the grocery store was the best idea. 
He is a hardworking man, with a good reputation, who seeks perfection in his business. That's why you can find his store filled with many different items requested by his customers. Today Fakher Eddine is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a Luncheon Meat Cutter necessary for his business.
This is his first experience with Al Majmoua, he hopes the future relation will sprout more success.

loans.use: To buy a Luncheon Meat Cutter necessary for his business

loans.name: Sevila

texts.en:
Sevila lives in kator. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Sevila heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase sugar, wheat flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 5 years. She describes herself to be customer friendly and understanding .Previously, she was involved in tailoring activity. She operates a retail store where she sells jiuce. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power during cold seasons. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fruits for blending juice to sell. Mariam dream and business goal is to be a supplier of juice to institutions like schools.

loans.use: to buy fruits for blending juice for selling.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen lives in kator. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 38 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Helen heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase tomatoes, onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions for sale.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
manal is a 41 years old married woman from al aqaba, Jordan and a mother of 5 children.
Manal is looking to improve her family life conditions thus she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to do maintenance for her house.

loans.use: to do maintenance for her house and renew furnitures

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is aged 62 years old married and supports a family of 6.  Philip owns a posho mill and has been in operation for a period of 5 years earning a monthly income of ksh 10,000. 

He   is servicing his first loan from KADET LTD Ksh 30,000 and intends to use the money to purchase dry maize for his posho mill.  The amount will be used to repay the loan and for his family upkeep.
 
His dream is to expand the business into other locations

loans.use: To purchase dry maize

loans.name: Amelida

texts.en:
Amelida lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Amelida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in kator. She sells perfumes, and has been in business for five years. She is 43 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Hawa heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase perfumes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Frida heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 4000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Bernerd

texts.en:
Bernard is a widower aged 57 years old and has 6 children. He owns a retail shop and has been in operation for a period of 2 years earning a monthly income of kes 10,000.  

This is  his  first loan  with kadet ltd of kes 30,000.He plans  to use the amount  to purchase paraffin, sugar , maize flour, wheat flour, washing detergents, washing bar soaps and bathing soaps, tealeaves  and cooking fat . The anticipated profit will be used to repay the loan and for his family upkeep.

His hopes are to prosper in business and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Maria Celendra

texts.es:
Señora María vive en la zona de la Maica Sud  parada 9 1/5 , ella tiene 31 años de edad estudio solo técnico en veterinaria, tiene un niño de cinco años de edad es madre soltera se dedica a la producción de leche tiene dieciséis cabezas de ganado lechero que tiene una producción de 175 litros diarios que los entrega a una persona de la zona que realiza quesillos.
 María no pudo estudiar la carrera completa ya que su padrastro murió cuando ella estaba en la universidad y al ser la mayor ella tuvo que dejar y trabajar con su madre para poder ayudarlos a sus hermanos a terminar el colegio ya que también su madre se enfermo y ella empezó con el trabajo de la producción de leche.
 María solicita el crédito para la compra de soya para su ganado porque desde que ella se convirtió en madre tiene su propia casa y su propio ganado y de esa manera sus propios ingresos con los cuales le saca adelante a su hijo ya que el padre lo abandono cuando el aun no nació. María sueña con que en algún momento vaya a terminar su carrera y de esa manera dedicarse a la veterinaria que tanto le gusta y trabaja el doble ya que ella quiere que su niño también tenga esa carrera.

loans.use: Compra de alimento para ganado vacuno

loans.name: Denis

texts.en: Denis is a 29 year old married man. He has a son who is 3 years old. He describes himself to be focused and humble . He operates a barber shop where he provides services of hair cut. He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located near a busy road and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high price of electricity bill. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a shaving machine and pay for the renovation of his business premise. His business goal is to run another barber shop in central business district of Nairobi city within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy another shaving machine and pay for the renovation of his business premise.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Jackline heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rawlinson

texts.en:
Rawlinson thirty seven years old married, he runs a Computer services business and has been in operation for three years earning a monthly income of sixteen thousand shillings.

This is his first loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan to purchase more computers.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business to other localities.

loans.use: to purchase more computers

loans.name: Dedeha

texts.en:
Dedeha lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Dedeha heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Señora Elena tiene 37 años de edad es madre de tres hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, viven en la zona de Maica Sud - Kenamari  ella se dedica a la producción de leche como su primera actividad y su segunda actividad la elaboración de quesillos, con una experiencia de diez años en dichas actividades. 
Ella es madre de tres hijos  dos mujeres y un varón todos son pequeños, el padre los abandono hace seis años atrás no saben nada de el. Elena se tuvo que dedicar de por completo a la educación de sus hijos y salir adelante ella entrega leche a la Pil cada día trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana todos los días y luego los prepara a sus hijos para que vayan a la escuela. 

Ella solicita el crédito para compra de soya, ya que con la temporada de lluvia se perdió todos los sembradíos de alf alfa que tenían, entonces le toca comprar soya para poder alimentar a su ganado y de esa manera tener más producción.  Elena es una persona responsable y dedicada al trabajo, ella sueña con que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y lo posterior estudiar alguna carrera ya que ella solo estudio la primaria y no tuvo una buena educación.

loans.use: Compra de Alimento para su ganado vacuno

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night lives in kator. She sells clothes, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Night heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice  is a fifty four  year old widowed woman with five children. She has rental and boutique business in Uthiru for three years now and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand  shillings. 


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to pay her daughter’s school fees. In future she wants to expand her business

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s school fees

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 19 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be responsible and organized . She operates a retail business where she sells groundnuts . She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located within a busy and viable estate  and her primary customers are passerby. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of permanent room for area of operation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more ground nuts. Her business goal is to own a permanent stalll for her business operation within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts.

loans.name: Fautuma

texts.en:
Fautuma lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for three years. She is 32 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Fautuma heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her third loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 1500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Teto

texts.en:
Teto is 39 years old married. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the last five years earning a monthly income of four thousand shillings. 


This is her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock of cereals for sale.

Her hopes are to expand the business to include wholesale and retail of cereals.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for sale

loans.name: Wasuk

texts.en:
Wasuk lives in kator. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 27 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Wasuk heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice for sale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 35 years old single with two children. She does farming and has been in the business for the last 3 years earning a monthly income of nine thousand shillings. 

This is her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the loan funds to improve her farming business.

Her hopes are to grow her business to include horticultural farming

loans.use: To improve her farming

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is a married woman. She describes herself to be creative, polite and God fearing woman. She operates a retail business where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable fast growing town and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenge to be high busfare cost when transporting the raw materials. She will use the Kes 10,0000 loan to buy raw materials for detergents. Rahab dream and  business goal is to own a manufacturing detergent and oil company within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making detergent for selling.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is forty years old married with three children. She owns a salon business. She has been in the business for the last five years earning a monthly income of twenty   thousand shillings. 


This will be Judith’s first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the loan funds to purchase more beauty products and open another salon. With the anticipated profit she plans to diversify the business.

Her hopes are to grow and expand the business into several branches.

loans.use: to buy purchase more beauty products and open another salon

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice lives in kator. She sells charcoal, and has been in business for one years. She is 32 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Joice heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 900 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam lives in kator. She sells food stall, and has been in business for four years. She is 39 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Marriam heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her forth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans, maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia lives in kator. She sells food stall, and has been in business for three years. She is 30 year old, married, and has four children; all of them are still in school. 

Sadia heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 800 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase beans,maize flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is  married with three children. She owns a green grocery shop. She has been in the business for one year earning a monthly income of ten thousand shillings. 


This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the loan to stock her grocery shop and buy second hand clothes. With the anticipated profit she plans to build a permanent structure for the business. 

Her hopes is to  provide for her family and become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase stock for  her grocery shop and second hand clothes

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José, trabaja como empleado realizando el control de parada de los trufis (trufis son taxis con ruta fija).
El crédito lo necesita para pagar el trámite de su licencia de conducir ya que necesita tener más ingresos para mantener a su familia y con la licencia podrá manejar un trufi y ganar dinero extra.
José, es divorciado y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.

loans.use: costo de trámite de licencia para manejar. Así podra manejar un trufi y ganar dinero extra para su familia.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is sixty six years old married with eight children, he runs livestock farming business.  He has been in the business for twenty years earning a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.


This is his second loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the entire loan to purchase more goats and cows, and with the anticipated profit he will pay school fees for his children.

His hopes are to be financially stable and live a better life

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cows

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana, trabaja como asistente técnica en una empresa privada dedicada a ayuda a la mujer en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de alquileres  por adelantado de la casa donde vive ya que de esta manera reduce su pago mensual y libera fondos para la manutención de su hijo y de ella misma.
Liliana, es divorciada  y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en una casa en alquiler en la zona Mallasa de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.

loans.use: Pago de alquileres por adelantado de la casa donde vive.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, es profesor jubilado y recibe su renta cada mes; también se dedica al comercio de prendas deportivas junto a su esposa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cemento, arena , estuco y pintura para la refacción de una habitación en su casa para dar más comodidad a su familia.
Mario, es casado y tiene cinco hijos vive  en casa propia en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la quinta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez junto a KIVA.

loans.use: Compra de cemento, arena, estuco, pintura para refaccionar una habitación en su casa.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita, trabaja como empleada en el área de limpieza en una institución pública junto a su esposo, este es el único ingreso que tienen para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo necesita para el terminado de obra fina en su vivienda para  poder vivir más cómodamente, pues actualmente la familia está viviendo en habitaciones que no están terminadas, pues falta poner estuco, pintar y arreglar los enchufes.
Rita es casada y tiene dos hijos, viven en casa propia en la zona Pura Pura en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.

loans.use: compra de materiales para terminar la obra fina de su casa.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 33 años madre de tres hijos, vive en la parroquia de "Abrahan Calazacón" en "Santo Domingo" que es un cantón de la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" el cual es uno de los más densamente poblados del Ecuador. Tiene un gran atractivo ya que posee varios monumentos distribuidos por toda la ciudad entre el que está el Monumento al Indio Colorado, sector conocido como la “Y del Colorado”.  Santo Domingo es un cantón privilegiado, con gente maravillosa, trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha incansablemente por el desarrollo y progreso, que recibe al turista siempre con los brazos abiertos y los lleva a conocer lo maravilloso de su cultura y entorno. 

A pesar de únicamente contar con la educación primaria, ha sabido mantener a sus hijos y darles tolo lo necesario para que lleven una vida modesta, y a pesar de las carencias que pudieran tener, no les ha faltado el amor y dedicación de su madre. Ella trabaja desde hace algunos años vendiendo comida asada, la cual prepara en una parrilla mediana en un puesto de comida a la intemperie; su jornada laboral es de cuatro horas al día. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus familiares.

Su parrilla ya necesita renovación, tiene varios agujeros a los lados. También quiere comprar una carpa y una hielera, y al no tener los recursos económicos disponibles ha optado por solicitar un crédito el cual le permita realizar esta inversión para que así pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y atraer nuevos.

Ella quiere incrementar sus ingresos, quisiera algún día tener un negocio más formal y a largo plazo construir su casa propia de tal manera que pueda asegurar el futuro de sus hijos.

loans.use: para comprar un nuevo asador, una carpa y una hielera

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth, se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva para ambos sexos; su capacidad de producción mínima es de 16 prendas deportivas por mes, las cuales son vendidas con seguridad a intermediarias que le compran inmediatamente pues los pedidos ya están hechos con anterioridad.  Esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar más tela para la confección de los deportivos, pues tiene un pedido mayor y así obtendrá mejores ingresos.
Janeth, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la séptima vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la cuarta vez junto a KIVA.

loans.use: Compra de telas para su negocio que es la confección de ropa deportiva para hombres y mujeres.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo tiene 48 años, vive en Tarija en la zona de la Comunidad de San Andres se encuentra casado tiene 3 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos. 
El señor Arturo se dedica a la actividad agricola, cultivan y cosechan hortalizas para comercializarlas en el mercado local, cuenta tambien con ganado vacuno, que le ayudan en la siembra de sus cultivos.
Arturo desea aumentar sus ingresos para ello esta invirtiendo en la compra de semilla y abono para la siembra de hortalizas en su terreno de este modo podra generar mas ingresos y en la siguiente oportunidad tener mayor capital y poder invertir en mas semillas.

loans.use: Compra de semillas y abono para actividad agricola

loans.name: Ramil

texts.es:
Ramil ha dejado su trabajo anterior por motivos de familia.Ahora Ramil, trabaja como administrador en una empresa de bebidas energizantes propiedad de su hijo, del cual percibe un sueldo cada mes.
El crédito lo requiere para realizar los trámites de ingresos de materias primas en aduanas, ya que el negocio es de su hijo y de esta forma ayudar al negocio familiar.
Ramil, es casado y tiene un hijo vive en la casa de sus suegros en la zona El Rosario en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.

loans.use: Costo de los trámites de ingreso en aduana de materias primas para la producción de bebidas energizantes para el negocio de su hijo.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad, trabaja elaborando papas fritas en su domicilio con ayuda de su familia para posteriormente repartirlas a las tiendas para las cuales elabora.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar papa en  cantidad  para luego procesarlas y tener más ingresos para mantener a su familia.
Trinidad, es casada y tiene dos hijos con los cuales vive en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.

loans.use: Compra de papa en cantidad para su negocio de elaboración de papas fritas.

loans.name: Nelly Carmita

texts.es: Nelly  de 41   años vive ( duran Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es la venta de comidas  le gusta y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días sola es madre soltera  la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia  . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande tener su vivienda en buen estado  y darle lo mejor a sus hijos  . con el préstamo comprara (víveres, como carnes, frutas, vegetales)

loans.use: carnes, frutas, vegetales

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes trabaja como secretaria en una entidad Pública en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para pagar la operación de su madre  ya que se encuentra delicada de salud y no cuenta con muchos ingresos.
Lourdes, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Alto Chijini en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.

loans.use: Costo de operación de su mamá.

loans.name: Darwin Javier

texts.es:
DARWIN JAVIER tiene 38 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 13, 11 y 9 años de edad en San Miguel de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC EL CONSUELO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Consuelo y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

DARWIN JAVIER se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, maíz, además tiene ganado y pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, balanceado. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar la producción. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel cada ocho días. El sueño es poder  incrementar el ahorro a la familia, tener un producto de calidad, tener un alto valor económico.

En el tiempo libre le gusta bailar en la época del carnaval.

loans.use: para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, balanceado

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos de 52  años vive (isla  Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque es una buena manera de tener dinero para poder darles lo necesario a sus hijos. Este negocio  que es el de tener un bazar y tambien vende perfumes para tener dinero adicional. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y le va bien gracias a Dios. Trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposa . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia  . a futuro anhela tener su negocio grande y tener su vivienda en buen estado . con el préstamo comprara (perfumes para seguir mejorando sus ingresos)

loans.use: perfumes

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, es electricista y trabaja en la zona Franca Industrial de La Paz arreglando los sistemas eléctricos de las movilidades que se encuentran dañadas y a la espera de los documentos de nacionalización; también vende repuestos de vehículos en la feria 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su vivienda  ya  que desea terminar la obra fina y  el armado de su techo solar para brindar más comodidad a su familia.
Israel, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la zona 16 de Julio en la ciudad de El Alto.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.

loans.use: costo de refacción y terminado en obra fina de su casa.

loans.name: Suley Cristina

texts.es: Suley de 30 años  vive (fortin Guayaquil ). Ella decidió prestar dinero para poder tener capital en el negocio del calzado. Le dieron el dinero y se puso su negocio de poco a poco. Ahora le va bien y se dedica a trabajar todos los días sola . la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia .a futuro ella anhela mejorar su casa . con el préstamo comprara ( ropa zapatos vitrina ect ).

loans.use: zapatoz vitrina

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr:
Catherine est une jeune femme agée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 2 ans. le prémier va déjà à l'école. elle possède un petit atelier de couture et sollicite un crédit  pour non seulement amenager son atelier construit en planches déjà en ruine, mais aussi augmenter son petit fonds de commerce en s'achetant plus de tissus, et une machine ce qui permettra d'augmenter ses ventes et de réaliser un bénéfice plus important.

le bénéfice tiré de ce prêt lui permettra d'ameliorer sa production, mais aussi d'aider son époux avec les petites dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: s'acheter plus de tissus et son matériel de couture

loans.name: Luis Aquiles

texts.es: Luis de 61 años vive (Quevedo Ecuador). El tenía una tienda pero la cerro por el motivo de que se separo de su esposa. A raíz de eso el decidió vender confites y betunar zapatos le va bien esa es la manera de salir adelante tiene 2 hijos ya mayores. la dificultad que él tiene es la enfermedad . a futuro el anhela tener bien su negocio y por el motivo de que perdió una pierna necesita comprar una prótesis para suplantar su pierna . con el préstamo comprara ( silla muletas, caramelos ).

loans.use: silla, muletas

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, se dedica  a la venta de dulces, fideos, pan y varios artículos de la canasta familiar ya que tiene una tienda de abarrotes de la cual percibe ingresos diarios.
El crédito necesita para aumentar su capital y diversificar su tienda con más productos para obtener mayores ingresos ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener  a su familia.
Silvia, es soltera y tiene un hijo con el cual vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona Villa Nueva Potosí en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la sexta vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.

loans.use: compra de más cantidad de productos como fideo, arroz, pan, sodas, etc., para ofrecer vaariedad a sus clientes en su tienda de abarrotes.

loans.name: Gladys Nathalia

texts.es: Gladys de 61  años vive (Portoviejo  Guayaquil). Ella decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia y al barrio porque no había tienda cercana.  Ella es viuda   por eso necesita trabajar para poder sustentar a su familia .lo hizo y le va bien. Trabaja todos los días solo tiene 3 hijos menores. La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia. A  futuro ella anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite arroz, lapiz viveres)

loans.use: lapiz, aceites, arroz viveres

loans.name: Nexi Karina

texts.es: Nexy  de 22 años vive (guasmo  Guayaquil). Ella anteriormente tenia un cónyuge pero la abandono. Por ese motivo decidió que era mejor tener  su negocio y que las ganancias solo eran para ella y se puso un gabinete gracias a la ayuda de su hermanos . Por ese motivo puso su peluquería y aparte  vende cosméticos. hasta ahora le va bien y se alegra de haber tomado esa decisión. a futuro anhela tener su negocio mas grande y tener personal profesional. Con el prestamo comprara ( tintes y sillón ).

loans.use: tintes, tijeras, secadora de cabello, sillon

loans.name: Medardo Marcial

texts.es: Medardo de 34 años vive ( isla Guayaquil  ) el empezó a trabajar en un  taller de ebanistería y aprendió mucho de muebles . por lo cual decidió entrar a un curso de ebanista  y ahora se puso su propio taller y le va bien . trabaja todos los días solo y a veces lo ayuda un primo es casado tiene 3 hijos  . la dificultad que tiene esw la delincuencia . a futuro el anhela tener su negocio grande . con el préstamo comprara ( materiales como cinta, cierra, madera ).

loans.use: cinta, cierra, madera

loans.name: Christian Eduardo

texts.es: Cristhian de 33 años vive ( orquideas Guayaquil ) gracias a la ayuda de su mama pudo comprarse un vehículo, escogio esta actividad de taxista porque le parecio muy buena ya que el es muy conocido en su barrio . decidio hacer expreso escolar y le va muy bien .  trabaja todos los dias solo  es casado.a futuro anhela tener una compañia de taxi . con el prestamo compara ( llantas )

loans.use: llantas

loans.name: Laura Edofilia

texts.es:
LAURA EDOFILIA tiene 29 años de edad es soltera tiene cuatro hijos, vive con la madre y los hijos de 8, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad en san Miguel de Bolívar.

Es integrante de la VRC EL CONSUELO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Consuelo y se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

 LAURA EDOFILIA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora, maíz, además tiene vacas lecheras. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, balanceado, líquidos para la maleza. Las compras y las ventas lo hace  en San miguel.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar los cultivos y la ganadería. El sueño es poder inculcar a la familia el ahorro, tener un producto de primera y en el negocio tener un buen incremento en la economía.
El desafío al que se enfrenta es el mal clima, muchas lluvias.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor y pasear.

loans.use: para comprar abonos, fertilizantes, balanceado, líquidos para la maleza

loans.name: Sandro

texts.es:
El señor Sandro tiene 44 años, está casado con la señora Carolina juntos tienen un hijo pequeño, el señor Sandro es huérfano de padre, esta situación fue muy difícil de asimilar para el cliente ya que ha tenido problemas hasta de su apellido, ya que el padre biológico jamás le dio su apellido, razón por la cual él adora a su hijo y siempre está con él apoyándole en sus estudios y en sus cosas personales. Pues ambos se fueron a trabajar a Estados Unidos donde trabajaba prestando servicios de mecánica y la esposa de niñera y con sus ahorros lograron comprase una casa en la ciudad de Cochabamba 
El señor Sandro y su familia viven al norte de la ciudad de Cochabamba, después de volver de Estado Unidos se dedica a  la compra y venta de vehículos, algunos de dichos vehículos los importa desde Estados Unidos, razón por la cual el destino del crédito es para capital de operación  ya que le falto dinero para la compra de un vehículo que estaba a un precio muy bajo, esta es  una oportunidad para realizar dicha compra ya que al vender tendrá más utilidad.
Entre sus sueños más grandes esta tener un taller grande de mecánica y trabajar en ella y además dar empleo a la gente de nuestro país.

loans.use: Capital de Operación - compra de vehiculo.

loans.name: Silvia De Jesus

texts.es: Silvia de 43  años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella  decidió entrar a este negocio porque quería ayudar en la situación económica de su familia .  la idea de poner ub¿na tienda es de su esposo lo hizo y le va bien . Trabaja todos los días solo . tiene hijos pero ya hicieron su vida. La dificultad que tiene es  la delincuencia . A  futuro ella anhela mejorar su negocio y tener un  local. Con el préstamo comprara (aceite arroz, enlatados)

loans.use: aceite, arroz, enlatados

loans.name: David Daniel

texts.es: David de 26 años vive (paraíso Guayaquil). El decidió entrar a este negocio porque anteriormente trabajaba  en algo similar. El se dedica a la venta de Cd alquilas lavadoras y vende agua. Trabaja todos los días con su esposa  tiene 2 hijos. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. a futuro el anhela comprar un carro para su negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( CD,  agua en botella)

loans.use: CD, agua en botella

loans.name: Agustín Rufino

texts.es: Agustín Rufino de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Él se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de maíz y frijol, esta última cosecha tuvo más demanda y no dió abasto a sus clientes, por lo que ahora quiere aumentar la producción, todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, siempre está la orden y con amabilidad a sus clientes; es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a lograr grandes éxitos en un futuro, piensa que sus más grandes secretos son la constancia y el amor a su labor, es así como se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de frijol y maíz por mayor para incrementar sustancialmente su cosecha. Agustín Rufino tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.

loans.use: Semilla de frijol y maíz por mayor

loans.name: Dagoberto

texts.es: Dagoberto de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en una humilde vivienda. Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de experiencia por lo que saca muy buenas cosechas, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda por parte de su clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; Dagoberto es un hombre entregado a su labor siempre dispuesto a aprovechar oportunidades que se le presenten, piensa que el carácter positivo es el que determina tu destino, él tiene ese carácter es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar insumos agrícolas y alquiler de tierra a fin de incrementar su productividad y consecuentemente sus ganancias. Dagoberto tiene la confianza que de esta forma llevará a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: Insumos agrícolas y alquiler de tierra

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana Lilian vive en una zona muy concurrida de personas, ahí se dedica a la elaboración y confeccción de carteras y gabachas, es muy conocida en el lugar, pues todo lo que realiza es creativo y de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, su clientela siempre queda satisfecha con el trabajo, además el servicio es único. Ana siempre los recibe con gran amabilidad; ella es una mujer emprendedora, muy entregada a su trabajo, con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que  para ser un gran campeón, tienes que creer que eres el mejor, si no lo eres, haz como si lo fueras, ella ya es una campeona es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela y papel  por mayor. Ana Lilian tiene fe que al incrementar su oferta dado que cuenta con mucha demanda podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Tela y papel por mayor

loans.name: Fabricio Rodolfo

texts.es: Fabricio Rodolfo de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia. El posee una panadería y vende pan en gran variedad dulce y salado, quesadillas, salpores, pastelitos, cachitos entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la clientela pues todo lo elabora con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente siempre recibe a las personas con una enorme sonrisa en el rostro; Fabricio es un hombre joven trabajador dispuesto a salir adelante y triunfar, tiene muchas metas por alcanzar, una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio para mantenerse adelante de la competencia, piensa que los campeones no se hacen en gimnasios, están hechos de algo inmaterial que tienen muy dentro de ellos. Es un deseo, un sueño, una visión, pensando así es como se decido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, leche, levadura, etc. Fabricio Rodolfo tiene la confianza que así podrá llevar seguridad económica a su joven hogar y alzar el vuelo para que su familia viva mejor.

loans.use: Harina por mayor, azúcar, leche, levadura

loans.name: Pedro
