texts.es: El Sr. Pedro tiene 37 años no esta casado pero tiene su pareja con la que tienen 4 hijos que son de las edades de  13, 11, 8 y 4 años todos ellos en edad escolar, el Sr. Pedro se dedica  ala elaboración de adornos de plástico todo esto es trabajo manual, estos adornos se utilizan en la época de carnaval para challar las casas nuevas y adornar sus casas esta es una tradición para carnavales, su domicilio se encuentra en la zona Pedro Murillo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Pedro utilizara este préstamo  para la compra de materia prima para su negocio, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es para la compra de materiales para la fabricación de adornos como bolsas de plástico y pegamento y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, el Sr. Pedro enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria por que hay varios artesanos que se dedican a la fabricación de adornos y utilizara los beneficios  para reinvertir y  producir mas adornos, es un apersona muy emprendedora y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MATERIAL PARA	FABRICACION DE  ADORNOS DE PLASTICO

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es: María Margarita de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una pupusería en el lugar de su residencia, ha sabido aprovechar cada espacio de su casa de acuerdo a sus necesidades, es muy conocida en el lugar pues las pupusas que elabora son exquisitas y tiene en variedad frijol con queso, queso con loroco, chicharrón, revueltas entre otras, todas hechas con material de primera calidad y las vende a precios accesibles últimamente ha aumentado la demanda y no quiere decepcionar a ningún cliente pues su servicio es el mejor; María es una mujer muy enérgica y entregada a su trabajo siempre está buscando la forma de superarse, piensa que siempre hay que soñar y apuntar más alto de lo que sabes que puedes lograr, ella está viendo alto es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, queso, frijol, chicharrón, verdura todo por mayor para ésta época de verano en donde los clientes estan de vacaciones y en lugar de comer en casa prefieren sus pupusas para cenar o desayunar. Margarita tiene esperanza que así podrá darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.

loans.use: Maíz, queso, frijol, chicharrón, verdura

loans.name: Carmen Claribel

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 32 años y es madre soltera con 2 hijos que son de las edades de  10 y 6 años, se dedica a la  venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra ubicado en la zona Villa Luz, este préstamo su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carmen va a utilizar este préstamo para compra de frízer y juego de mesas y sillas por su negocio, La razón para solicitar este préstamo es hacer crecer el negocio, la Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son  la competencia en el mercado y utilizara los beneficios compra de un lote de terreno. Ya que sueña  tener casa propia para dar  comodidad a su familia, la Sra. Carmen se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: Compra de Frizer y juego de mesas y sillas

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su querida familia en zona rural del país. Él se dedica al cultivo y comercio de granos básicos como: maíz y frijoles. Cada año repite esta actividad, siembra la semilla, saca la cosecha y por último pone  a la venta una gran parte de ella. De esta forma se gana la vida y cabe aclarar que es su principal fuente de ingresos. No cuenta con terreno propio para cultivar la tierra por lo que cada año alquila unas manzanas de tierra para poder continuar realizando sus siembras que son los que le han permitido hasta hoy: crecer y alimentar a su familia. Manuel se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y muy responsable. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de él y confían en el producto que comercializa. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución, INTEGRAL, para solicitar credito y comprar los principales insumos agrícolas (semillas, pestisidas, abonos, etc.) y alquilar mayor cantidad de tierra que en años anteriores a fin de pretender obtener mayor cantidad de productos. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que obtendrá resultados favorables y podrá lograr su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar:semillas, pesticidas (veneno para control de plagas), abonos, etc.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: La Sra. Zaida tiene 36 años  y es madre soltera con 2 hijos  que son de las edades de 7 y 12 años ella se dedica  a la venta de  gaseosas en un local que se encuentran en sexto anillo, donde también tiene una rockola donde ofrece servicio de entretenimiento a sus clientes con música que ellos escogen, el préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución y  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra  de sillas y mesas de plástico para su negocio, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de comprar cosas nuevas para dar comodidad a sus clientes, la Sra. Zaida  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir creciendo y  utilizara los beneficios en brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela, la Sra. Zaida es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

loans.use: compra de sillas y mesas de plasticos

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Florencia habita  en humilde casa de su propiedad ubicada en zona rural junto con sus queridos hijos. La señora Florencia se dedica junto a sus hijos a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Los frijoles y el maíz son los principales cultivos que cada año cosecha. Esta actividad la realiza junto con sus hijos mayores que son los que se encargan de gran parte del trabajo dado que la señora Florencia también se dedica a las tareas del hogar como madre tradicional. Cultiva, cosecha y comercializa en el pueblo cercano a su localidad los granos básicos. De esta forma se gana la vida en esta actividad que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Para ella lo más importante es que su familia cuente con lo necesario para sobrevivir, esto es lo que la motiva a trabajar muy duro día con día para poder dar a su familia el pan de cada día y poder suplir las principales necesidades del hogar. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTGRAL para invertir en los insumos agrícolas  (abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc.) que le permitan realizar la siembra de este año y poder obtener la mejor cosecha. Espera que los resultados sean favorables y pueda lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida  a las que por el momento tienen ya que su situación es muy difícil económicamente.

loans.use: Para comprar: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, etc.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel de 58 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad situada en las afueras de la ciudad, junto con su esposa y dos hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Cultiva maíz y frijoles, dicha actividad la repite año con año ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de él y de su familia ya que viven en condiciones muy humildes y día con día la situación económica se complica y las necesidades de su familia son mayores. Esto lo motiva a trabajar con más entusiasmo ya que solo con el trabajo logrará dar a su familia lo que tanto desea. Son estas razones para que haya decidido acercarse a INTEGRAL y solicitar este crédito que le permita invertir en los insumos agrícolas (semillas, abonos, pesticidas, etc.) necesarios para el cultivo de la tierra y continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar. Espera lograr su objetivo de dar a su familia todo lo que merece y poder elevar el nivel de vida al pretender incrementar su productividad.

loans.use: Para comprar: semillas, abonos, pesticidas, etc.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa del Carmen tiene 51 años de edad y habita en casa familiar junto con su hija de 16 años la cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace mucho tiempo. Teresa se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de superarse. Para ella lo más importante es su familia. No pierde las esperanzas de algún día ver a su hija convertida en una profesional y con mejores oportunidades de vida a las que ella tuvo acceso. Esto es lo que inspira a Teresa a trabajar duramente en su tienda  que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado establecer. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya logró ganarse la confianza de muchas personas. El objetivo de Teresa  es surtir su negocio de tal manera que la capacidad del mismo sea más grande y logre cubrir una mayor demanda. Esta inversión piensa hacerla por medio de un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos propios necesarios para hacerlo. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los productos necesarios (arroz, frijoles, pan dulce, galletas, dulces, golosinas, detergente, aceite, etc.) para mantener surtido su negocio y que le permitan alcanzar su objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda de tal forma que sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados y poder así dar a su familia diferentes oportunidades de vida. Tiene mucha confianza de alcanzar el objetivo trazado ya que es una mujer perseverante y siempre logra lo que se propone. La señora Teresa expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución ya que en el pasado solicito un préstamo y le brindaron la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, gracias a ello y su excelente administración creció su negocio, espera que al igual que en el pasado le otorguen este crédito que tanta falta le hace para desarrollar mas su negocio.

loans.use: Para comprar: arroz, frijoles, pan dulce, galletas, dulces, golosinas, detergente, aceite, etc.

loans.name: Nelson Joel

texts.es: Nelson Joel tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus hijos. Vive rodeado de un ecosistema muy agradable. Para Nelson lo más importante es su familia la cual es su principal inspiración para luchar día a día por un futuro mejor. Él es un hombre increíble ya que a pesar de que es un joven tiene muchas iniciativas de negocio las cuales le han dado muy buenos resultados. Nelson se dedica al cultivo de maíz y de hortalizas, flores naturales. Tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad por lo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos personas en su vecindario los cuales cada día lo prefieren más.  Para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con los productos  que ofrece, razón por la cual siempre está pendiente de tener los productos  en buenas condiciones. Últimamente ha notado un aumento en la demanda de sus productos y muchas veces se queda desabastecido. Por tal razón ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en  la compra de los insumos necesarios (semillas, abonos, insecticidas, regadillos, etc.) para el cultivo del maíz flores naturales y de las hortalizas con el fin de contar con una mayor producción que permita mejorar sus niveles de ventas e ingresos. Espera tener resultados positivos que le permitan accesar a una calidad de vida diferente para él y su querida familia.

loans.use: Para comprar: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, regadillos, etc.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro  de 59 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañera de vida. Él  posee un molino de nixtamal el cual es su principal herramienta para trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día. Muchas personas solicitan su servicio dado que les facilita sus tareas ya que en el molino del señor Alejandro pueden moler diferentes granos como: maíz, frijoles, arroz y café. Además los clientes expresan estar muy satisfechos con el trato y servicio que reciben. Esto ha permitido que muchas personas lo prefieran y sigan solicitando su servicio. Con mucho trabajo y dedicación ha logrado mantener este negocio a flote aunque últimamente ha notado algunas fallas en el molino ya que por el uso requiere de algunas reparaciones y cambio de repuestos. Esto es lo que ha llevado a Alejandro a acercarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar crédito que le permita invertir en la compra  de un motor nuevo que reemplace el viejo, discos nuevos y poleas. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes ya que sin esta herramienta no podría seguir trabajando para ganarse la vida y suplir las necesidades de su hogar. Está muy agradecido con esta institución ya que en el pasado recibió ayuda cuando más lo necesitaba, espera que en esta ocasión sea igual por el bienestar de los suyos.

loans.use: Para comprar  motor de gasolina, discos y poelas nuevas

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús de 30 años de edad, habita junto a su familia en casa familiar. El posee un molino de nixtamal el cual atiende junto con su familia, moliendo maiz, frijoles, salsas, chocolate, granos secos, entre otros. El se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, honrado, justo y sobre todo trabajador. Se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en su vecindario ya que para él lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que reciben.  Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener a flote su negocio y es así como lo quiere mantener por mucho más tiempo, ya que con los ingresos percibidos pueden suplir muchas de sus necesidades que cada día son mayores. Ha notado que con el tiempo el molino necesita algunas reparaciones y cambios de repuestos, ya que si no se le da mantenimiento podría fallar en cualquier momento y dejar de  prestar el servicio. A toda costa quiere evitar que su molino se arruine por completo por lo que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de repuestos para su molino, con el fin de seguir prestando el buen servicio que hasta el momento ha dado a sus clientes. Espera que los resultados de esta decisión sean favorables ya que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos y sin el dinero que ingresa del molino la situación sería demasiado difícil dado que la situación económica cada día es mas demandante.

loans.use: Para comprar repuestos para molino de nixtamal.

loans.name: Reynaldo Ovidio

texts.es: Reynaldo Ovidio de 33 años de edad habita en casa familiar junto con sus padres. Él se dedica al cultivo de cereales y hortalizas desde hace muchos años. Es un hombre muy trabajador que se caracteriza por ser responsable, dedicado y emprendedor. Cada año realiza esta actividad ya que  es su principal fuente de ingresos y es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a sus padres. Para él lo más importante es que su familia este en mejores condiciones a las que tiene actualmente y eso es lo que lo motiva a trabajar duramente  para poder cambiar la realidad que viven él y su familia. Este año al igual que los anteriores quiere cultivar la tierra y sacar la cosecha que le permite llevar lo necesario a su hogar. Dado que no cuenta con recursos propios para comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para la siembra, ha tomado  la decisión de acercarse a esta institución, INTEGRAL, para solicitar crédito y así poder  comprar  lo necesario para el cultivo como: semillas, abonos, regadillos y venenos para control de plagas. De tal forma que esto le permita seguir  cultivando la tierra que con tanto amor y esperanzas realiza. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta forma su situación económica  y la de su familia mejorarán.

loans.use: Para comprar: semillas, abonos, regadillos y venenos para control de plagas

loans.name: Sonia Guadalupe

texts.es: Sonia Guadalupe de 43 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposo e hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de tamales y pastelitos fritos rellenos de carne y verdura. Su negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación el cual está en una de las calles principales donde ella habita. Además algunas veces realiza la venta en el mercado municipal de la zona donde ella habita. Trabaja muy duro para poder contribuir un poco con la economía del hogar ya que lo que su esposo gana no alcanza a cubrir las principales necesidades que cada día son mayores. Tiene la ventaja que muchas personas la prefieren por ser una mujer carismática, higiénica y muy responsable. Ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchas personas en la zona.  Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su negocio ya que quiere cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado para que de esta forma pueda mejorar sus ventas y niveles de ingresos. Esto la llevo a presentarse a INTEGRAL para solicitar este crédito para invertir en la materia prima necesaria (maíz, pollo, verduras, sal, etc.) para la producción de los ricos tamales y pastelitos que cada día son más las personas interesadas en comprar. Es una mujer de metas y tiene mucho optimismo que con esta decisión logrará lo que tanto desea: mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar: maíz, pollo, verduras, sal, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca Lidia de 42 años de edad, reside en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida de 46 años y su hija de 14 años de edad en zona semiurbana. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia. Blanca es una mujer emprendedora llena de metas y sueños. Para ella lo más importante es su familia la cual la impulsa a seguir adelante y trabajar duramente para darles lo necesario. Últimamente ha estado pensando mucho en la manera de hacer crecer su negocio ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos y piensa seguir manteniéndolo activo y recibiendo los frutos que hasta el momento ha recibido. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, pan dulce, huevos, golosinas, etc. Para surtir su negocio con el fin de atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel de ventas e ingresos de tal manera que su calidad de vida y la de su familia se vea mejorada.

loans.use: Para comprar: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, pan dulce, huevos, golosinas, etc.

loans.name: Sok Keang

texts.en: Sok Keang, 37, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been cultivate corn, sesame and been for over ten years, earning approximately USD 7 per day. Two of her children are farm workers who earn approximately USD 5 per day. Sok Keang is asking a loan of USD 500 to rent farmland where she is planting her crops. This money would enable her to acquire the security with this agricultural work. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland for her crops cultivation and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to rent farmland where she is planting her crops

loans.name: María Ángela

texts.es: María Ángela de 56  años de edad, vive en su propia casa junto a su querida familia. María se dedica a la producción y venta de pan. Su negocio está establecido en su hogar de residencia que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener  durante muchos años, ya son varios años de ofrecer delicias de pan como semitas rellenas de jaleas de piña, reposterias, salpores de arroz y almidon, por mencionar algunas de sus especialidades. Muchas personas la prefieren por ser una mujer muy amable, trabajadora, higiénica y muy carismática. Ella ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia ya que es lo más importante y es quien le da las fuerzas para seguir luchando. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de comprar la materia prima para la elaboración del delicioso pan dulce que cada mañana prepara. Con él crédito piensa comprar insumos como: harinas, azucares, canela, colorantes, leche, huevos, margarinas y mantecas. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de lograr mejores niveles de venta e ingresos que  por consecuencia lleven a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Para comprar: harinas, azucares, canela, colorantes, leche, huevos, margarina y manteca

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en: Thavy, 37, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 11 per day. Her husband runs the business of purchasing horse to resale and earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are employed. They are construction worker and horse cart runner. Approximately, they earn USD 5 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Thavy is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital in her husband’s business for purchasing horse to resale. By doing so, her husband would generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her husband’s business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living

loans.use: to raise capital in her husband's business for purchasing horse to resale

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es: María Cruz de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad , arroz, frijoles, leche, pan, huevos, entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues tiene su tienda bien surtida y siempre satisface a su clientela, además los productos que comercia son de primera calidad y los vende a precios accesibles; María es una mujer emprendedora muy honrada y con mucho entusiasmo de salir adelante, piensa que nunca hay que desistir de un sueño, sólo tratar de ver las señales que te lleven a él, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, productos instantáneos, bebidas, etc. María tiene la confianza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Granos básicos, golosinas, productos instantáneos, bebidas

loans.name: Tang

texts.en: Tang, 30, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in rubber plantation for over seven years, earning approximately USD 10 per day. In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Tang would like to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family. Therefore, Tang is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase cashew nuts to resale for a profitable price. In the future, she would like to expand her new business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts to resale for a profitable price

loans.name: David Armando

texts.es: David Armando de treinta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad  frijoles, huevos, leche, jabón, entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado su demanda pues todos los productos que comercia son de primera calidad y los vende a precios realmente accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable siempre se encuentra a la orden del día, para todo el que visita su negocio; David es un hombre emprendedor y muy dedicado a su labor, siempre aprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan; piensa que cuando alguien desea algo debe saber que corre riesgos y por eso la vida vale la pena, él quiere correr el riesgo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón incrementar así su variedad de productos y oportunidades de mejorar sus ventas. David Armando tiene fe que así podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.

loans.use: granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón

loans.name: Mouy

texts.en: Mouy, 43, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in potato cultivation for over four years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Additionally, her husband is a construction foreman. Approximately, he earns USD 7 per day. One of her children is a garment worker who earns about USD 2 per day. Mouy is asking a loan of USD 1500 pay for the rent of land where she is planting potato. This money would enable her to acquire the security with this agricultural business. In the future, she would like to run an additional business to generate more income to support the family and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of land where she is planting potato

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es: José Andrés de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en zona semiurbana del país; el posee un molino y una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad como granos básicos,  bebidas, jabones entre otros, es muy conocido en la zona, pues tiene en sus negocios lo que los clientes necesitan, además de que lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles y el servicio es único, los atiende a la perfección; José es un hombre trabajador  con muchas metas a futuro, piensa que el mundo está en manos de aquellos que tienen el coraje de soñar y de correr el riesgo de vivir sus sueños, él tiene ese coraje es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan , huevos, bebidas, y mantenimiento de molino, comprando discos y poleas nuevas. José Andrés tiene la esperanza que así logrará para su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: granos básicos, golosinas, pan , huevos, bebidas, mantenimiento de molino, comprando discos y poleas nuevas

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina de sesenta y uno años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos en casa propia, Ella posee un comedor y una pequeña tienda en el lugar donde reside, tiene una excelente ubicación su negocio, vende gran variedad de platillos exquisitos carne asada, pollo, arroz, sopa, entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que elabora, es hecho con material de primera calidad, con mucha higiene y lo vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; Adelina es una mujer muy enérgica a pesar de su edad siempre se encuentra activa en el trabajo, nunca desaprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan, piensa que lo más importante para llegar al éxito es la perseverancia y el amor a la labor, es así como se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar carnes, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas, etc  a fin de poder abastecer a clientes que de los alrededores le visitan. Adelina tiene la confianza que así podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.

loans.use: carnes, verduras, granos básicos, bebidas

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Luis Ernesto de cuarenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el posee una venta de tortas y pupusas, es muy conocido en la zona pues tiene la venta de comida más rica del lugar, sus clientes siempre quedan satisfechos, el prepara todo con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios bajos además el servicio es inigualable siempre recibe a las personas muy cordial; Luis es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador, siempre aprovecha cada oportunidad que se le presenta porque sabe que solo así podrá llegar a el éxito, piensa que cuanto más duro trabaja más vale la pena lo que hace, últimamente ha experimentado un incremento en su demanda, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, carne, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, verduras, etc. Luis Ernesto tiene la esperanza que abasteciendo de mayor variedad y cantidad de sus comidas hará que sus ventas incrementen y así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: pan, carne, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, verduras, bebidas

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús de sesenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, el posee una venta de ropa y otros artículos varios, que de forma ambulante promueve en principales calles, parques y mercados cercanos a su casa; últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, en estas vacaciones quieren aprovechar para que aumenten sus ventas por eso surtirán más el negocio; Manuel es un hombre visionario, dispuesto a alcanzar el éxito, piensa que lo que importa es cuanto amor ponemos en el trabajo que realizamos, para que así sea más grande la felicidad, ya ha manejado creditos y es muy buen cliente, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor y otros artículos de uso personal como calzonetas, sandalias, bloqueadores solares, antitranspirantes, lociones. Manuel de Jesús tiene la confianza que incrementando la variedad de sus productos sus ventas se elevarán y así podrar elevar el nivel de vida de su querida familia

loans.use: ropa por mayor y otros artículos artículos de uso personal como calzonetas, sandalias, bloqueadores solares, antitranspirantes y lociones

loans.name: Antonio De Jesus

texts.es: Antonio de Jesús de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una venta de huevos y verdura, son muy conocidos en la zona ya que se dedican al comercio ambulante y porque todo lo que comercian es de primera calidad, fresco e higienico y lo vende a precios realmente accesible además el servicio es excelente; Antonio es un hombre inteligente con muchas metas a  futuro , piensa que hay que dejar que nuestra vida devore los sueños, y no sean los sueños quienes devoren nuestra vida, con este pensamiento se decidió a solicitarle  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar huevos por mayor y verduras. Antonio de Jesús tiene la confianza que de ésta forma sus ganancias mejoren y pueda darle a su familia una vida con mejor proyeccción de futuro

loans.use: huevos por mayor y verduras

loans.name: Napisa

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Napisa obtain her first Kiva loan, which were used as intended and repaid. She was able to broaden an assortment of goods and obtain new customers. Now Napisa has applied for a loan of KGS 80.000 for raising her turnover. Revenues from this loan will be used for purchasing materials for her house reconstruction.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 52, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing vegetables to sell for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. All of her children are employed. They are truck driver, barber and fish vendor. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. In order to improve her family’s living condition, Sarom is requesting for a loan of USD 1100 to raise capital in her child's business for purchasing more fish to resale. This money would enable her child to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living condition for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her child's business for purchasing more fish to resale

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok, 59, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling breakfast food (porridge, noodle) for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed in garment factory. Approximately, they earn USD 12 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sok is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Him

texts.en: Him, 50, is married, resides with her husband and a daughter in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a retirement teacher who can earn about USD 2 per day. Her daughter runs a cosmetic shop in the market. She earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her daughter’s business, Him is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more cosmetics for her daughter to resale. This purchase would help her daughter to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand the business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide enough space for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her daughter to resale

loans.name: Dim

texts.en:
Dim is a farmer living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is dedicated to herself to rice farming business. She has many-year experience of doing this business. Kong, her husband is very supportive and helpful to manage the maintenance at the rice field beside construction work. This couple has given birth to 2 children, who are students attending in local state school and in need of daily allowances. 

Dim would like to maintain a sustainable living for the family, and therefore she is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to purchase a trailer, from which vegetables, groceries and meats, beefs are sold. She believes that most people around the community will buy her products rather than to spend much time to the market.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer, from which vegetables, groceries and meats, beefs are sold.

loans.name: Rouern

texts.en: Roeurn, 46, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 3 per day. Three of her children are employed in the factory. They earn about USD 10 per day. Due to the difficulty in her farming work, Roeurn is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a pumping machine to pump the water into her rice field. This purchase would help her provide enough water for her plant and get higher yield. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine to pump the water into her rice field

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin is 43 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and 4 single children in Prey Chor district, while the other two children are married and live in separated homes.  Sin is in the business of rice farming to earn a living. She is able to generate approximately 1.50 USD per day. 

In the next two months, Sin is going to prepare a wedding party for her third child and she realizes that she will make a great expense for it. Due to insufficient capital, Sin would like to ask for a loan to pay for the wedding party preparation and make it start soon. She hopes to get the loan from our lenders and she is confident to pay it back on time as it’s now her forth cycle loan from HKL. She is very thankful.

loans.use: to pay for the wedding party preparation.

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham, 50, is married, resides with her husband and two children Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband runs the business of sound equipment rental. Approximately, he earns USD 5 per day. One of her children is a construction worker in Thailand. He earns about USD 4 per day. In order to improve her husband’s business, Cham is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase four more speakers for her husband to run the business. This purchase would enable him to provide better service to client and earn more profit. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand the business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase four more speakers for her husband to run the business

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, 44, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling coconut for over six years, earning approximately, USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who earns about USD 5 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earns about USD 7 per day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Phan is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Nom

texts.en: Nom, 40, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a cleaner in provincial hospital for over ten years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband runs public transportation (motor taxi). He earns about USD 3 per day. Due the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Nom is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This purchase would enable her to go to work on time. In the future, she wants her husband to run Tuk Tuk instead motor taxi because it earns more money, and she hopes to help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan is 50 years old and a loving father of 5 children. He has been residing with her family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, Phan is engaged in animal trading besides rice husbandry. He buys and sells cows at the market place of the province, earing approximately 7.20 per day. His wife helps him earn income by raising some piglets at home. This couple has strong commitment to provide their children a good education. 

He would like to take this loan to buy construction supplies and pay for workers performing the construction. He wish to have a nice house, which will provide the entire family with a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay for workers performing the construction.

loans.name: Koiy

texts.en:
Koiy, 60, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry and growing vegetable to sell for over five years, earning approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband is a primary school teacher who earns about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about USD 9 per day. 

In order to stabilize her family’s living condition, Koiy wants to run additional business to generate more income to support the family. Therefore, Koiy is requesting a loan of USD 1300 to purchase silk threads to weave cloth to sell. 

In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and help her youngest child get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase silk threads to weave cloth to sell

loans.name: Oeung

texts.en:
Oeung is a hard working mother who helps her husband manages a rice farming business from Batey district, Kompong Cham province. She is 25 years old and has four young kids who completely depend on the family’s income. She has a commitment to provide her children education through learning in public schools. 
Oeung has been in the business for more than 10 years. This business has existed since her ancestor generation and it was handed down continually to her at the present. In order to increase a high production of rice, Oeung would like to take out a loan to purchase and expand her rice plantation.  She hopes to obtain a good harvest and income in the coming seasons.

loans.use: to purchase and expand her rice plantation.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon, age 58, is a mother of a big family with seven children: two single and five married children. She lives in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She involved herself in rice farming business to earn a living. She has fewer duties to look after her children since they are employed and become independent. 

With the amount she requested from Kiva, Huon will add to her capital to start up a business selling groceries in a local market to improve the household income. Her daughter will also support her in this type of business. She used to borrow four loans from HKL already. And this will be her fifth loan given to make change her family’s status.

loans.use: add to her capital to start up a business selling groceries in a local market.

loans.name: Phoen

texts.en:
Phoen is 43 and a married mother of six children, five of whom are living together with her under the same roof in Batey district of Kompong Cham. Aside from helping her husband in the farming business, she also take high responsibility for managing household things, take care of the family and provide a good education to her children. Phoen and her husband work hard to maintain a quality of life for their children and ensure a bright future for them. Oum, her husband, decided to involve himself in animals trading to increase the family’s economic financial needs.

Due to the lack of capital, Phoen is asking for an addition of 4, 000,000 KHR for her husband to purchase cows for trading. She mentioned that the loan will help her improve the business and thereby increase the family’s household income.

loans.use: to purchase cows for trading.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Samnang, 29, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables for over ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 5 per day. In order to improve her business, Samnang is requesting a loan of USD 500 to raise capital in her business to buy all kinds of vegetables to resale. This loan would help her to make more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house to provide convenient living condition for the family.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to buy all kinds of vegetables to resale

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha , 30, is married, resides with her husband and one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been running the parking spot service for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a high school teacher who earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sokha is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would help her reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: No

texts.en: No, 29, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sweetish cake for over seven years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Her husband is a soldier who earns about USD 5 per day. In order to stabilize her family’s living condition, No would like to run an additional business. Therefore, No requests a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a truck to run the delivery service. This purchase will help her earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a truck to run the delivery service

loans.name: Sophany

texts.en: Sophany, 44, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in breeding pigs for over four years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 8 per day. One of her children is employed as a team leader in the garment factory and earns about USD 6 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Sophany is requesting a loan of USD 1500 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Reum

texts.en: Reum, 50, is married, resides with her husband and two children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over two years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about USD 2 per day. In order to improve her business, Reun is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to resale. This purchase would enable her to generate more profit to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the further profit to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree. Moreover, hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger to provide convenient living condition for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resale

loans.name: Altantsetseg's Group

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her daughter, aged 5, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends kindergarten. 

Altantsetseg supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. When she first began her business, she had 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) in working capital. Now she has 5,000,000 MNT in working capital. She sells jeans and trousers, which she imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Altantsetseg is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more jeans to sell in order to increase her jeans and trousers variety. Her goal is to expand her business and then to be able to improve her daughter’s education. She is one of our trusted client who is thankful to all Kiva lenders.

She is a group leader and she overarmed on the picture.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans and trousers to sell

loans.name: Nith

texts.en: Nith, 28, is married, resides with his wife in Kampont Province, Cambodia. He has been running public transportation service (motor taxi) for over four years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. His wife is a garment worker who earns about USD 3 per day. Due to the present motorbike is too old; Nith is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one to run the service. This purchase would enable him to attract more customers and earn more income to support the family. In the future, he would like to run Tuk Tuk instead of motor taxi because running Tuk Tuk earns more money. Moreover, he hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one to run the service

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Lorn, 51, is married, resides with her husband and four children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over twenty years, have an extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up cattle. Approximately, they earn USD 4 per day. Three of her children are garment workers. They earns about USD 12 per day. Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Lorn is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to reduce her transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family’s living.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute

loans.name: Nheb

texts.en: Nheb, 44, is married, resides with her husband and three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in corn cultivation for over ten years, earning approximately USD 8 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. They earn about USD 8 per day. Nheb is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a plot of land for constructing a new house. This money would help her to get a comfortable place for her family’s living. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for constructing a new house

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей.  В 2000 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала бизнес в животноводстве, использовав для этого сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). 
Замира трепетно и с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу - благодаря такому подходу, на сегодняшний день Замира имеет в своем хозяйстве 7 коз с приплодом, 4 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 лошадь и 6 жеребят. Несмотря на трудоемкий и объемный труд, который отнимает много времени, Замира также  занимается и полеводством, обрабатывая 0,5 га земли с клевером, кукурузой и картофелем. Ежемесячный доход от такого хозяйства составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS), часть которого откладывается на оплату дочери в университете. 

В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобыл для торговли кумысом (кобылье молоко). Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья.
texts.en:
Zamira is 35 years old, married, and is raising 4 children.  In search of an income for her family, in 2000, Zamira began her business in animal husbandry with 25,000 som (KGS).  Zamira does her work reverently and very seriously.  Thanks to this approach, today Zamira's farm has seven goats and their offspring, four cows, two calves, one horse, and six ponies.  Regardless of the vast amount of labor intensive work, which takes a lot of time, Zamira also farms.  She works 0.5 ha of land where she grows clover, corn, and potatoes.   Her monthly income from the farm comes to about 7,000 som (KGS), a part of which she sets aside for paying her daughter's university tuition.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Zamira applied to Bai Tushym & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) for purchasing mares so she can sell kumis (mare's milk).  Zamira is planning to invest the income in further increasing the number of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is 34 years old. He lives in a village of Khelvachauri District, West Georgia with his family: wife – Natia and parents. Guram and Natia are employees of a local company and they get monthly salary. Along with their main job, they are actively involved in family agricultural business. They have 0.4 hectare land, where vegetables, fruits and various citrus are grown. Guram’s parents sell harvested fruits and vegetables on local open market. Total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Guram requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. It will be placed in an old cattle-shed building, located in the yard of Guram’s house. The family will start production of cheese and they will sell it on local open market as well. The income of the family will increase by 150 – 200 Laris per month. The increased income will allow them to purchase needed additional household goods, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Arusik

texts.en:
Arusik is 48 years old. She lives in Akhalkalaki District, South Georgia with her family: husband – Temur, 18 years old son and 75 years old mother in law. Her son goes to school. 

The family earns on living through agricultural business. They have 3 milk cows. Arusik produces cheese and sells it on local market. Along with the dairy farm the family has a plot of the land, where they grow potatoes. On spring season Arusik and Temur spend most of their days on their plot. They are busy with seasonal agricultural work. They harvest potatoes in summer and sell it locally to greengrocery products retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris. 

Arusik requested credit for purchasing potatoes for sowing. Also part of the loan will be used for purchasing drugs to treat the plants against parasites. Arusik and Temur hope that the weather conditions will be favorable and after properly done seasonal works the family will get good harvest, which will be sold for convenient price. Arusik will reinvest part of received profit in the same business and will use the rest for financing ongoing family daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing and drugs for treating the plants from parasites

loans.name: Datuna

texts.en:
Datuna is 37 years old. He lives in a small village of Zestaponi District with his family: wife – Khatuna and 3 children. Khatuna works as a cleaner in the local school. Datuna leads the agricultural business of the family. They have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows. Khatuna produces cheese and sells it on local market. Also they have a greenhouse with the area of 900 sq. meters. Datuna grows cucumbers in the greenhouse during whole year. He sells cucumbers to local greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris. 

Datuna requested credit for purchasing seeds of cucumbers. He will purchase quality seeds and sow them in the greenhouse. Also part of the requested credit will be used for purchasing polyethylene, for covering the greenhouse, as the old one is already torn and can’t keep the needed temperature in the greenhouse. As a result of above-mentioned investment the family will get good harvest during the year, which will be sold for convenient price through already existing distribution channels and the family will get more income, than in previous year. The increased income will allow the family to spend more on family daily expenses and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of cucumbers and polyethylene for covering the greenhouse

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara is 62 years old. He lives in a village of Zestaponi District with her husband – Gurti. Lamara and Gurti are retired. They earn on living through family agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with 3 milk cows and 5 calves. Lamara produces cheese and sells it on local open market. Also Gurti works as worker in the village. Total average monthly income of the family is 500 Laris. 

Lamara requested credit for purchasing construction materials for construction of a new, bigger cattle-shed. Existing cattle-shed can’t place more than 3 milk cows. The new cattle-shed will allow Lamara not to sell calves and raise them. As a result of the abovementioned in the future the family will have more milk cows and thus get more milk for cheese production. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to purchase additional goods for household, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for cattle-shed construction

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi is 33. She lives in Ayntap village with her husband, children, husband's brother and father-in-law. The main income for the family comes from agriculture: cattle breeding and land cultivating. Zaruhi has applied for this loan to develop the farm. With the requested amount she plans to purchase rabbits and renovate the barn. 
This loan will help Zaruhi to get more income from agriculture, which will help her to insure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to pay for rabbits and barn renovation

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 38 years old. She lives in a small village of Terjola District with her family: husband – Grigol, three children (13, 17 and 19 years old) and father in law (retired). Younger children go to school and the elder one is a student. Grigol works in a local company as operator. Maya is leading the agricultural business of the family: they have a milk cow. Maya produces cheese and sells it in the village. Also the family owns a vineyard with 1200 vine-trees. Maya and Grigol produce wine and sell it in the village. Along with the abovementioned the family has 80 nut trees. They sell nuts on local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 450 Laris. 

Maya requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. With two milk cows Maya will be able to produce and sell doubled amount of cheese. The monthly income of the family will increase by at least 200 Laris. Maya will use increased income for financing education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón, tiene la edad 83 de  años, está casado y vive con sus hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el engorde de pollos y la compra de los mismos. El cuenta con las instalaciones para los pollos y lo que pretende es darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de los hijos y crecer con le proyecto de cría de pollos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: compra de pollos de engorde

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es: María Maritza, tiene la edad  de 56 años, está casada,  vive con sus cinco hijos y el esposo  actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar gallinas ponedoras y el concentrado para el mantenimiento de las mismas. El tiene pensado comprar las gallinas pequeñas y mantenerlas hasta su producción y así poder vender los huevos  a un excelente precio al mercado de la localidad, así poder  obtener más ganancias  para obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.

loans.use: Compra de gallinas ponediras

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is 45 years old and married to Sang. They have four children, three of whom are single and lives together with them. Kun owns a few hectare plot of land on which she plant and cultivate rice. Kun uses traditional method she learned from her ancestor to do farming. However, she works hard and obtains a good result from the harvest. Farming is the only source of the family’s income. She has been in the business for almost 22 years.

Kun would like to acquire some funds to purchase cashew nuts in stock and resell them to make more profit in the future. Someday, with her determine, Kun hopes to achieve economic stability and ensure a bright future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cashew nuts in stock.

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing is 32 years old, a resident who lives in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married and has been blessed with two school-age children. Saing works hard in rice farming business to uplift the family’s standard of living to provide them a better life. With the help of he husband, Saing enjoys doing her daily activities much and she pursues to make a good harvest from the rice field each year. Saing has been involved in this business for almost 21 years.

Siang requested credit from HKL to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local farmers. She hopes to make it profitable. With the increase in income, Saing wants to renovate her present house that is not so strong and comfortable to live.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk from local farmers.

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Khut is a 46-year-old married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is in the business of making mortar mill after rice husbandry. This type of business is required her to be more patient. Khut uses the profit she earns from the business to cover her daily expenses.

As of now, she requested a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to purchase a cow for the maintenance at the rice field. Khut described that to have a cow will help her family to make progress of the business and she can reduces some expenses as she did in the previous on the plowing fees. She hopes she will be successful in managing the business someday.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for the maintenance at the rice field.

loans.name: Pal

texts.en:
Pal, 45, is a farmer living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice among the two seasons of the year. She is married and has four children, some of whom are employed and work in Phnom Penh city. And her last-born child is attending school and needs daily allowances. Pal would like to improve her farming practices but she needs additional capital to support it forwards.

Recently she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for two-hectare plots of land she rented from other villager and buy potato plants for growing. This loan will enable her to ensure a good progress of her crop farming business and thereby increase her household income.

loans.use: to pay for two-hectare plots of land she rented from other villager and buy potato plants for growing.

loans.name: Ri

texts.en:
Ri is 67 years old and a diligent mother of six children, living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She grows and sells vegetables to earn a living. She has her children help managing this business since she becomes older. However, her spouse is the main income provider of the family. He travels by buffalo going through the commune and market with a trailer full of firewood to sell.

At the present, Ri is taking out a loan to buy cashew nuts in bulk and resells for a profit. With her hard work and the help of this loan, Ri hopes that she will be able to attain success from her investment and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts in bulk and resells for a profit.

loans.name: Lerng

texts.en:
Lerng, age 57, is a loving father of four children; three are married and the other one is single. He’s a widower who lives with his children in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Lerng is involved himself in firewood selling business to provide the income for the family.

He would like to sustain and improve his business but he has insufficient funds so he is asking for a loan to purchase stock of firewood for a constant sale. He has been a client of HKL for a few years. This will be his third loan and he found that it’s very useful to make changes in his living status.

loans.use: to purchase stock of firewood for a constant sale.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean is a responsible mother who pursues to provide a standard of living for the family. She is 26 years old and has 2 school-age children. She earns a living by doing farming, raising pigs and selling Khmer cake in the commune. Kean would like to expand her farming business to increase her production and to income to satisfy her family’s basic necessities in the coming years. She told us that the main important thing in her life is to provide a good education to her two her children. For that reason, she has a commitment to work hard and continually support them, so that they can earn a degree and become professional someday. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to purchase construction supplies and to pay for the construction fees. She hopes to see her house will be done soon and it’ll be a comfortable one for the whole family. She is very happy for the given fund to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and to pay for the construction fees.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 3 years. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a grocery store where she sells kales, spinach and onions. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a fast growing area and her primary customers are local residents of her village area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables . Maureen's dream and  business goal is to own another grocery store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 28 years. She describes herself to be honest and ourgoing. She operates a grocery store  where she sells vegetables such as cabbages, kales, spinach etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at a strategically residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the grocery retail store. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more vegetables . Maria's dream and business goal is to have a permanent structure for her grocery store business operation within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josephine is a 33 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 7 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a grocery store  where she sells fruits such as mangoes etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more mangoes for selling. Her business goal is to own several such fruit selling grocery retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydiah is a single woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a retail stall where she sells cereals such as beans, maize, black beans etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a busy and viable market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase cereals . Her business goal is to be a supplier of cereals in large quantities within 5 years.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 30 year old single woman. She describes herself to be self-motivated woman. She operates a beauty salon where she provides services of hair such as blowdrying, plaiting etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located near an estate and bus station and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be sometimes  low purchasing power from customers. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase a dryer. Her business goal is to run another beauty salon  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have the biggest salon in her business area.

loans.use: to buy another dryer.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a 50 year old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be self-motivated man. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located at a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of charcoal . He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to purchase twenty bags of charcoal. His business goal is to buy a motorcycle to aid in delivery of charcoal to customers within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be selling charcoal in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells home product such as sugar, salt, sodas, stationery, bread etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a busy estate and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of spacious room for the business operation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy  two bags of flour. Her business goal is to own another retail shop  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger room for the business operation.

loans.use: to buy two bags of flour.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 40 year old widowed woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 18 years to 29 years. She describes herself to be aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals . She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located near a shopping mall and her primary customers are wholesalers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation of cereals . She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy four bags of maize. Her business goal is to supply  cereals to at least ten supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a lorry to aid in transprtation of the cereals to the customers.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of maize.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 58 year old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 28 years. He describes himself to be ambitious man. He operates a food stall  where he sells chips. He has been involved in this business for 20 years and employs 1 staff members. His business is located at a busy residential area and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of potatoes . He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to purchase potatoes for making chips for selling. His business goal is to be supplying chips to schools . He hopes that in the future, he will own a big shop and venture into business of supplying potatoes .

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for making chips for selling.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John  is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 5 years. He describes himself to be aggressive man. He operates a food stall  where he sells plastics, clothes materials and utencils  such as cups, plates, spoons etc. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located at a busy and conducive business environment  and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items . His business goal is to run a general shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will run several  such general retail shop.

loans.use: to buy plastics, clothes materials, utencils etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 9 years. He describes himself as ambitious . He operates a general store and also farming  where he sells home products such as sugar, salt , flour, bread etc and also sells goats . He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in  a conducive business environment  and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of home products .Peter plan to use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home products. Peter' dream and  business goal is to venture into transportaion services business .

loans.use: to buy home products for selling.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Patrick  is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 9 years. He describes himself to be ambitious . He operates a retail store where he sells items such as flour, salt, sugar, bread etc . He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in  a conducive business environment  and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more home products. His business goal is to venture into transportation industry business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more home products.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson  is a 32 year old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 6 years. He describes himself to be intelligent . He operates a motorcycle where he provides transportation services . He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a densely populated area and along a tarmac road  and his primary customers are local residents . He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle . His business goal is to run a stable transportation business.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth  is a married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 27 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be aggressive . She operates a retail business  where she sells clothes . She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are business people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of pemanent room  for carrying out the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes . Ruth's dream and  business goal is to be a wholesaler  within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy one bale of skirts for selling.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a single mother of one child. Gladys is involved in the transport industry; a business she started from her savings. Besides this, Gladys also sells clothes.
She was introduced to Milango by her friends. Owing to the desire to obtain more income for her family needs, Gladys is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to start a grocery/vegetable shop. 
Her future ambition is to increase the number of motor cycles in the transport industry and believes the additional income from both businesses will help her achieve her long term desire of building rental houses.

loans.use: To start a grocery/vegetable shop.

loans.name: Nyamai

texts.en:
Nyamai is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. She is a married mother of two school going children aged twenty and seventeen years. Nyamai owns a grocery stall which has been in operation for nine years. She sells vegetables in this business and also runs a charcoal business.
Nyamai is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of charcoal. The grocery business faces the challenges related to supply during the dry seasons and this is the reason why Nyamai complements the sales with those from the charcoal business.
The extra income will help her pay for her children’s school fees. Her dream is to own a larger shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a single mother of two children. She owns a school which has been in operation for three years. She began the school from her personal savings.
Millicent is applying for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to purchase desks and text books and other teaching aids. She believes that the progress she has seen so far and be able to establish a fully fledged primary school in the near future. Her only challenge is some students not paying the fess on time. The additional income from this loan will help Millicent pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To  purchase desks and text books and other teaching aids.

loans.name: Florrah

texts.en:
Florrah, a resident of Mariakani, Kenya and sells brooms in the Coastal town of Mariakani. She is a mother of nine children. She started the business from the savings accumulated from the previous retail shop. Florrah also sells water to the residents of Mariakani and rental houses within the town area. The area is situated along the highway and receives many guests en route to either the Kenya capital or the Coastal towns.
Florrah is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to purchase a generator to pump water for sale. The additional income will help her to finish/complete the construction of her guest house.

loans.use: To purchase a generator to pump water for sale.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is single and has a grocery/vegetable stall which has been in operation for one year; a business she started through a loan from his parents. She previously operated a retail shop and now looks forward to restarting the retail shop. 
She learnt of Milango from her friends and is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase retail stock and vegetables. The challenge facing her business is high cost of fuel/transportation and cost of stock.

loans.use: To purchase retail stock.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées et vivant exclusivement dans des familles nucléaires, les cinq femmes du groupe  Atechi ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de céréales, des produits de beauté et des habillements. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 10 eme  prêt solidaire. Tous les neuf prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté
Madame, Koumba (la femme assise de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de  céréales. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de mil et 6 sacs d’arachide à la foire de Cinzana Gare. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au marché de Ségou et à domicile. 
Avec ce prêt, Koumba espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments, en frais scolaire et sanitaire. 
A l’image de Koumba les autres membres du groupe ont pour ambition de construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou.
texts.en:
All of them married and living exclusively in nuclear families, the five women of the group Atechi average 41 years of age and five children each. The women all live in the Bagadadji district of Ségou City (4th administrative region of Mali) and know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They buy and sell grain, beauty products, and clothing.
